review: Effexor (venlafaxine):Don’t be afraid to take this medication. Don’t read the bad reviews do what is best for you. I suffer GAD, depression & panic attacks more so now than ever. This medication was one of my tools to help me feel me again. I have been on it for 10 weeks and I’m now getting off of it because I feel it’s best for me. Only side effects nausea and headaches. Before I wouldn’t be able to step foot in a grocery store, public but now I can with out panicking or having anxiety. It doesn’t take it all away but it’s something that will help.

This has been the most successful anti depressant I’ve tried for my anxiety. But oddly enough it doesn’t help that much with the depression. Still, I’m thankful to have it and for the anxiety relief it gives. It also didn’t take as long to work as other anti depressants, I was feeling better a few weeks after starting it, where in the past I would only notice an effect a couple of months in. (The other anti depressants exacerbated my anxiety though.)

Effexor XR (venlafaxine):I have been on Effexor XR since I was a teenager, about 12 years. I do wholeheartedly believe that this medication saved my life at that time but I have fluctuated in dosages. Within a couple of years I was up to 150mg which worked for a long time. I eventually went up to 300mg which isn't recommended and have been trying to wean off. It will take a few months to notice an effect and the withdrawal symptoms are AWFUL. If I miss more than 1 day, I will not be able to walk. Usually it is only recommended as a 3rd or 4th option for a reason.

Effexor XR (venlafaxine):I really resent being put on Effexor XR as a child without my parents being told that it was addictive. Sure, I was bipolar (type 2) and needed an antidepressant, but the psychiatrist should’ve put me on something that wouldn’t give me withdrawals when I miss even one dose.I ran out of Effexor one December while waiting for it in the mail. For a week, I was having horrible symptoms- chills, rapidly fluctuating moods, vivid nightmares, crying spells, nausea, and so much more.I want to be able to get off of the Effexor, but after taking it for 20 years, I think it’s too late.

Effexor XR (venlafaxine):I’ve only been on this for one week but what a difference! I usually wake up depressed and have low energy. About an hour after I take it I have energy and feel so much better! So far so good. It’s the lowest dose so no side effects to speak of. I’ve tried every antidepressant out there and none have helped or had bad side effects. I’m almost afraid it’s too good to be true. Fingers crossed that this will keep working. I’m 61 by the way. Don’t give up hope.

Effexor (venlafaxine):I stopped taking this after a week because of extreme negative effects. Super nervous tension. Muscles constantly tensing and I could not relax. Pacing around the room. Yammering and stuttering when I spoke. Inability to get a night's sleep. Chest pain/ tightness. Racing heart. And then finally, dramatically rising blood pressure forced me to stop. And that was just on 37.5 mg of the XR.

Effexor XR (venlafaxine):This was one of the drugs that affected me instantly. I don't feel hopeless anymore. I take complimentary drugs too for sluggishness and other symptoms of my depression so hopefully I feel like I'm gonna get rid of this disease once and for all now.

Effexor (venlafaxine):This medicine took away my anxiety and my ability to orgasm. It came back after I'd been off it for about a year. It made me feel emotionally numb. Nothing made me cry. It's been 7 years since I took it, and I still haven't cried. I used to cry all the time. I'm sad at times. Just no crying. Also, scary movies didn't scare me. At all. I also had some mild brain zaps when I quit taking this. Not bad.
It took 6-7 weeks to have full effect, but was worth it. No more anhedonia, lethargy or anxiety. Love this medicine.

Effexor XR (venlafaxine):I was put on Effexor in the hospital after having a complete nervous breakdown. I had never been on an anti-depressant before, it was my first. I gained 90 pounds in 6 months. I was so exhausted that I would sleep all day and all night, waking only to eat. I had no motivation at all. I was having the most bizarre and disturbing nightmares every single night. I didn't even want to go to sleep because I was so terrified of the nightmares. I started getting rashes on my arms every time I went out in the sun, like a sun allergy. I've had depression for a long time and I've had a lot of feelings like "I just don't want to be here anymore" but on the Effexor I was having extreme suicidal ideation, like actually planning it out and thinking about it vividly every day and night.  I stopped after 6 months because my doctor said none of those were side effects of Effexor and it was all in my head but I did a ton of research and there were a lot of others having the exact same side effects.

I have complex trauma, depression. Been taking venlafaxine quick release for 4 months now and it has helped with flash backs and disassociation but my depression is at an all time low and is not picking up yet! I’m waiting to have my dose upped! Has anyone had similar experience? I didn’t really get side effects just dry mouth and sometimes felt sick if didn’t eat with it, I have no appetite either x

Effexor XR (venlafaxine):I tried to jump out of moving car because I thought I was dreaming. No one warned me about this side effect. You should know that severe dissociation is a (rare) possibility before taking this medication. It also made me loopy. People said I was slurring my words and thought I was drunk. It affected my memory so badly that I couldn't remember to do daily tasks like preparing food, laundry and bathing. People were always mad at me because I couldn't follow conversations. It ruined my quality of sleep. I always felt buzzed on caffeine yet exhausted at the same time. This was on 75 mg: what most doctors consider the lowest dose.

After going through a number of different antidepressants with my GPS, and having various side effects with all of them, Venlafaxine is the one I have managed to stay on the longest but have decided to come off of them due to the side effect of complete lack of appetite and interest in food.This medication got me through some of the worst stages in my life and I went up to the maximum dosage of 225mg and then down to 150mg.Unfortunately, forgetting to take a dose does lead to some serious hangover type symptoms; brain fog, shakes & jitters, headache, tiredness and lots of grumpiness as well as emotional instability.

Beware. After a divorce it gave me a slight mood increase each morning. But in the evening I would feel agitated and low. Each day when it was time to dose I would have terrible brain zaps and feel agitated and horrible. Also ruins sex drive, causes night sweats and a zombie-like feeling. Dividing the dose did not help. Add-ons did not help. By the time I tapered I was left with a strange agitation that seems permanent. Re-instatement of alternate SSRI meds 1 year later made it worse so I did another taper and have been off for several years. Still have agitation, mood disorders also did not help. Doctors are clueless. Only through my own research can I find scholarship that recognizes a protracted WD syndrome. Ativan helps but cannot be used daily because of addiction. If you are experiencing a situational depression try to get through it natural. Doctors will admit SSRI can alter your brain in a positive way but seem less willing to say the same about long term negative changes.

Effexor XR (venlafaxine):Effexor helped me slightly- I've been dealing with chronic OCD, anxiety, and depression since I was a kid. I've tried 3 SSRI's, Clomipramine, and Abilify before this drug. The drug helped improve my mood a bit, but didn't seem strong enough to help the rest of my issues. Just know before taking that this drug is difficult to taper off of; I felt sick when tapering. However, the drug has very minimal side effects and is easy to tolerate. I felt the effects within a few weeks

I have been on the drug for 3 months and can say that it has made a significant difference in my levels of anxiety and depression.  I have a very stressful job which compounded the anxiety.  The first 2-3 weeks I did experience some nausea however that has now gone away.   I would recommend this drug.

Effexor XR (venlafaxine):Log history of depression and anxiety mainly from being connected to and extremely toxic, dark, manipulative and abusive father. I recently separated and my mind and emotions are healing but I was still depressed. I admitted myself for the 3rd and hopefully last time and they put me on Effexor and Abilify, I felt better within a few days, now about 2 weeks my mind and vision are becoming so clear as it was what I was 6 before I was destroyed. I was recently discarded and subsequently very paranoid, that has almost completely vanished and calm peaceful feelings are taking its place. Plan to stick with it. I take 150mg daily.
Many antidepressants don't work for me but this one does. No side effects with the lowest dose. I'm very satisfied.

Venlafaxine may have saved my life. April 2020 I was going down hill fast. Never needed depression meds but at 33 had lost control. Work/personal stress, new baby, lack of sleep, COVID hit, and job changes. After a year I finally realized it was also Paternal Postpartum Depression as well. Tried a couple different drugs that caused more symptoms than they solved (Buspirone was the worst). Doctor gave me Venlafaxine and took 75mg first dose June 12th, 2020. I'd say within a month there was noticeable improvement. I tried coming off Venlafaxine by going down to 37.5mg and felt anxiety/depression increasing. Stopped messing with dose and stayed on 75mg. I have had zero depression for about a year. Anxiety will show up but is definitely reduced. I feel normal and have more energy. The waiting for results is terrible when you need help NOW. But I was given Ativan to help me in the beginning which worked very well when I had panic flare ups. Haven't needed Ativan in about a year.

Effexor XR (venlafaxine):Worst drug ever, I've fallen victim to permanent life destroying side effect PSSD (post SSRI sexual dysfunction)  Theres no cure for it, and makes a persons life a living nightmare

My doctor pushed this stuff on me because I expressed that I wanted to come off of Sertraline, and antidepressants altogether. She thought Sertraline wasn't working, I trusted her. Bad decision. I had been on Sertraline for 3 years and was ready to try life on my own. I never wanted to be medicated in the first place but knew I needed some kind of assistance. Switching to Venlafaxine was the worst thing that I could've done. Right away it gave me vertigo, nausea, headaches, stomachaches. And it continued off and on throughout me using it. This stuff is awful! Now 7 or 8 months later after 1 month of tapering off of this medication, I have the bad effects x100! I think I'm suffering with discontinuation symptoms. This feeling is awful. Now I have constant Vertigo, nausea, with added lack of desire to eat, disorientation, tiredness, I just feel sick 24/7. I hate this stuff! I blame both my doctor and this medication for my experience. Would not recommend to my worse enemy.

I have been on venlafaxine XL prolonged release for a month now for anxiety, depression and BPD psychosis. I have lost count of the different medications I have tried over the years but it’s just about finding the right one for you so don’t give up.  It will NOT work immediately so please give it time to get it into your system. The only side effects I experienced was feeling a bit more tired than usual but nothing extreme that it would effect my day to day life, the biggest side effect for me was loss of appetite (which works in my favour! But I understand that won’t be a positive for everyone) but absolutely  no feeling sick or drowsiness. I haven’t had a depressive episode since taking them, I’m still a bit anxious but unfortunately there’s no such thing as miracle drug but venlafaxine, I know at some point I will have a down day but that’s natural for everyone mental health issues or not. I hope this helps someone, stay strong!

I used  venlafaxine to help with my depression. I was really down and it was the worst depression that I had in my life also because I was on the really hard and long Lockdown in Argentina on 2020.Fore sure it helped me, I was still depressed but however much better than without this MED.By end of 2020 I went back to Germany, I was much better and ready to start something new. No fear of COVID.But 20 days latter I was infected and that was the big surprise!!!!! People around me were sick, I as I didn’t developed ANY symptoms, just nothing !!!!! I thought I can’t never ever be COVID, maybe some Flu for the people around me or something else !!!However, 3 weeks later I moved to Berlin and as my Home Doctor is also Virologist, he offer me to do an COVID blood test in order to know if I already had COVID or not.After Some Days I received a Call from Laboratory, they told me I have antibodies.I think venlafaxine helped me from not getting too sick from COVID 19 !

I started having more energy with 75 mg already but haven't seen improvement in other symptoms. Then after I started taking 150 and 225 mg all hell broke loose. My depression got much much worse and I developed intense suicidal urges...on top of that I started to experience noticeable common side effects. Not the right one for me sadly.

My name is Jody Santos I suffer from PTSD severe depression Anxiety and Panic Attacks I will get to the point I was on venlafaxine since 2012. I started off with 25 MG then boosted up to 75mg to end up to 175mg. Well on February 3rd 2012 my doctor refused to refill my prescription I called and asked my new doctor and they advised they couldn't either due to the point I would have to start all over again with a new Therapist. My pharmacy was kind enough to give me a 3 day supply but after that I went through what I can tell you was a horrible nightmare from Brain Zaps, Nausea, Headaches, Bodyaches, Insomnia, Rage, Crying all the time, Hallucinations, Horrible Night and Day time sweats, paranoia, tingling in my arms, fingers and legs. It hit me worse on my whole right side numbness. I was experiencing things I never had before all due to not getting weaned off properly. I called so many doctors explaining my situation and due to Covid was unable to see anyone until April 3rd

I've been on the generic for almost a year now and while I'm on the lowest dose (37.5mg), it has been incredibly helpful. The first month my biggest side effects were bloating and being constantly tired. Luckily after my body got used to it, they went away. The main issue with Effexor is withdrawal symptoms. If you miss even one dose, you start to feel the effects. For me it comes in the form of getting super dizzy. I'd say that's the biggest thing to take into consideration. Weaning off any type of antidepressant can take a lot of work, but with Effexor it can be a lengthy and intense process.

I had a horrible experience with this medicine. It was great at first. I started feeling normal again, but once I forgot it even a few hours off. I began having bad withdrawals. I was nauseated, had a bad headache and my anxiety was through the roof. I honestly couldn’t describe the experiences I had from them. It was an out of body experience every time. After 6 months I just couldn’t do it. When I stopped cold turkey which I don’t recommend. I began having really bad withdrawals. Headaches that lasted for days. Vomiting from my nausea that also lasted for days. Nothing helped. I couldn’t sleep, drink or eat without throwing up. Eventually my doctor tapered me off. But I never want to experience that again

Took it for 1.5 years. Quit June 9th, 2021 because of side effects. Today is November 18th and I'm still having withdrawal symptoms. Horrible stomach pain, body aches, headaches, irritability and more. Do NOT take this drug. It will ruin your life.
Effexor XR (venlafaxine):worse medication I have ever been on, and try to get off of it, I ended up in the hospital.

This drug has changed my life I went from sleeping all day and all night to waking up at 6 or 7 am with loads of energy. I wake up with a smile on my face. I went from wanting to kill myself every day almost to wanting to wake up and scream I’m so happy. I take it at night because it was making me sleepy when I took it in the morning at first it made me feel like a zombie but I switched to it at night and it was a game changer. Thankful I have finally found one that works. I still have some bad days but maybe 2 out of a month Instead of every single day being horrible.

I have been taking venlafaxine for 8 months and it has greatly decreased my depression and anxiety. I was on Wellbutrin 150mg and it was not working for me at all. My MD started me on 75mg of Venlafaxine and I feel so much better. I feel normal again. The first week was horrible for me though. I stopped the Wellbutrin cold-turkey and started Venlafaxine immediately after. I had horrible anxiety for that first week and I could not sleep. After that first week, I started feeling better and was able to start functioning like a human being. The only negative thing I would have to say about it is that I weighed no more than 108lbs when I started it and today I weighed 134.8lbs. The weight gain has been a down-side for me and I will be talking to my doctor about it at my f/u. This medication does work! You just have to stick it out through the negative parts.

Effexor (venlafaxine):This medication has literally saved my life. I finally feel like myself again. My over thinking and constant unease is basically gone. I still am me and not feeling altered. I tried bupropion and it was awful for me, which turned me off from medication all together and  I was so hesitant but so glad I decided to try Effexor.

Effexor XR (venlafaxine):Was diagnosed with generalized anxiety, depression & social anxiety. First started 10 mg Citalopram and had a horrible reaction which made me think I was about to go to the psych ward, caused a couple panic attacks too. Started 37.5 mg Effexor XR and now I’m at 112.5 mg. Depression improved drastically at 112.5 mg, and was a bit noticeable at 75 mg, 37.5 did nothing. GAD seems gone, mostly. My social anxiety which mostly resolves around me feeling inferior to others, over analyzing interactions with people, & a fear of making friends & going to the store. Among other stuff. I haven’t noticed my social anxiety change much, which makes me feel  a bit rubbish but it’s not debilitating per-say so it’s okay.. I guess…

I have taken it with marvellous results of peace of mind and productivity for 15 years. Then it came a crazy doctor, a kind of purist of what he read in its studies and not considering the patient, so he diminished from 4x75mg to 1x75: what a disaster! After seeing the effects of his "policy" he is returning to what it was before.This is a "miraculous" medicine, very often misinterpreted and with some misinformation of people who didn't experienced it for much time.Support some four weeks of secondary effects and, if it is good for you don't change it more...!

I’ve taken, Prozac, Zoloft, Celexa, Wellbutrin, just about everything since I was eighteen years old. I’m 54 and thing’s started getting real bad for me. I’ve suffered trauma and have PTSD. No interest in going out side, developed a fear of people due to abuse. Started on 37.5 mg of Venlafaxine then two months later 75 mg. It’s changed my life. I have a new energy and I no longer suffer from anxiety. I’m no longer paranoid and my depression is gone. This medication is a miracle. Side effects were headache , increased heart rate, a little agitation. Goes away after a week. I got my life back

This drug ruined my life, made me end a 10 year relationship I would have NEVER LEFT! before I knew it, IT destroyed ME and my ability to love my partner, I was convinced we had problems and convinced I couldn't love her. I lost myself but the scary part is I thought I was doing OK, I could not see the changes in myself but my personality was slowly altered month on month.  If you are on this drug and are making big decisions you feel are right, but maybe wrong... STOP NOW, GET HELP AND DON'T DO WHAT I DID. This drug will wipe you for what you got, intimate relationships will die, sex life will be ruined, love will go She was the love of my life and I destroyed everything, blamed her and lost connection on this drug. She was the best person I ever met and I lost her now and regret everything. I would get off this if you want life to have any meaning right away, don't do what I did

I’ve been on antidepressants all my life. I’m 54 and my depression worsened. Not wanting to get out of bed, I developed bad social anxiety and just felt like I couldn’t hang on. VENLAFAXINE 75mg saved my life. NEVER has any medication worked like this one. I have renewed energy, I’m happy and satisfied, no more anxiety!!!! It’s a miracle

I have never felt so off in my life. This has made being a single mom nearly impossible. Would not recommend this medication to anyone. Trouble with a sense of reality motion sickness feeling like I'm falling in place, rapid heartbeat, night sweats, very surreal, bad dreams already had an eating disorder now worse can't eat. Will never take again!

I'm on Effexor 150 mg for depression, anxiety, migraines. I have suffered from anxiety and migraines since I was a child, I started suffering from major depression as a younger teen. I went years battling everything by myself, I was put on Effexor about 9 months ago and at first I didn’t think it was helping but I went on taking it, about 2 months into it is when I started to see a difference in myself. I feel like a new person, my life is so much better, I have found happiness in myself. This medication changed my life ❤️

Hi,  I have been battling depression (moderate) since March this year. I use VENLAFAXINE 75mg extended release tablets and TRAZODONE prolonged-release for sleeping (300mg in the evening) But in September my doctor told me that I need more of Venlafaxine because I didn't have energy.So I started to take Venlafaxine 150mg in the morning. I have common side effects like sweating in the night, which I don't like  :-( But I have more thoughts about harming myself or ending mt life!!! I have never have any experience with  self-harming behaviours before :-( Sometimes I have suicidal thoughts. I  have more energy but much more of these thoughts and I strongly suspect that it is from venlafaxine! I told about it to my doctor, but I think it seems to me that the doctor doesn't trust me much. Is there anybody who has the same? THANKS

Effexor XR (venlafaxine):I was on this medication for over 8 years. I recently (finally) was able to wean off of it with the help of a psychiatrist. It has been almost a year since I stopped use of the drug and my sex drive has not returned, my emotions are still numb, I still feel some of the effects. I am still in a fog. This drug "really works!" for the first month or two, then stops working. Then your doctor has you increase your dose, same thing. Until you are stuck on it and addicted. As most have explained, the withdrawal from this is horrible. But most don't even tell you that you never return to normal.

Currently been on this medication for just under 2 years after previously trying sertraline that didn't agree with my system so got swapped to this. Worst 2 years of my life yet my happiest?! I got engaged, I bought my first house, a new car, a new job, a puppy. Everything within 2 years that makes people extremely happy. And yet... I felt numb. I knew I should be happy however I just seen it as nothing to celebrate? I was put on this medication for anxiety and depression and yet its the most depressed I've felt. Not to mention I gained just under 2 stone when I never changed my diet or exercise routine from anything I'd ever done before. I gained this amount of weight and the dr couldn't explain why. Yet all you have to do is come online, google the medication and there you go... other people have experienced weight gain. This led to further depression.My advice is, take your Dr's advice to a certain extent and other peoples reviews. However, remember everybody is different!! 0 stars

Effexor XR (venlafaxine):This Antidepressant seems like it works for 90% of people however I fell into the 10% group that it was an absolutely horrible experience. The best comment I saw on here described it as "like mdma but only the bad effects !!!"   the past month of my life and I fell back into a low time and after not leaving my bed for a week, I went back to the doctors and was prescribed 37.5mg for a week and then 75mg for another 2 weeks. In this time my mental health only got worse, I didn't get me out of bed and eventually I broke down, couldn't handle it anymore and voluntarily got admitted into the psych ward at hospital. Long story short, new doctor swapped me to Valdoxan and boy oh boy highly recommend. Its new on the market and recommended to 18-65 is year olds but absolute game changer.

I took this medication for 3 1/2 years. 225mg/150mg when I was feeling "better".During the first months/year, it was amazing. I felt great, confident, anxiety under control, even though side effects were already strong (terrible sweats, body trembling, constant weight gain, nervosity, overall agitation).The third point is major. I gained over 70 lbs in 3 years. I was just unable to loose weight, whatever I did. I went from M to 4XL in 3 years. I was craving carbs, eating all the time, my appetite was constant. It destroyed my self-confidence, increased dramatically my anxiety when going out, and right now it is difficult to go out and live normally. Among my friends taking the same drug, we all suffered : weight gain, difficulty to urinate, increased irritability. On the good side: decreased anxiety, and effective to manage major depression.Overall I do not advise taking this medication for more than one year.

Effexor XR (venlafaxine):I was worried taking this med but I also really wanted it to work. For me, it did not, even though it was on my GeneSight Go list. I have battled depression on and off most of my life and I have always responded well to the older tricyclics which are basically SNRI’s so I figured this has got to be a newer, better SNRI version. I kept telling my psychiatrist that it was making me tired and depressed and we kept going up in dosage. Got some pretty dark thoughts on this, too. Maybe it helped a bit on anxiety. Took it for about 9 months. When it was time to come off, I literally had no withdrawal so not everyone goes through those. Dr had warned me about this med and not to miss a dose, etc, due to the short half life and then warned me again coming off. She was amazed I got off it so easily but basically said it probably just wasn’t doing anything. I’m sticking to the older tricyclics. Trial and error.

I was overmedicated on this drug which led to me being manic. I was sectioned under the mental health act. I was admitted to hospital where I was made to withdraw from the drug instantly and not slowly. I begged to be allowed to do it slowly but they would not let me. I was strangled by a fellow inmate and the police were called. This drug ruined my life! Initially in line with all the other patients I was diagnosed with Bipolar. Every patient including me was given rispiradone to make them like a zombie. I spat mine down the toilet and no one knew. I have lost my marriage as a result and 2 of my children do not speak to me. DO NOT TAKE THIS DRUG IT RUINED MY LIFE>

This is without a doubt the worst drug I have ever taken. It made me no longer care about anything, and after I started taking it I found myself delving into process and substance addictions, something I had never formerly engaged in.Why? Why did you do this to me? I was just an abused boy in pain who asked for help, and this is what you did. Shame on you.

Effexor changed my life. I had my first episode of psychosis last year after battling depression for 4-5 years unmedicated. I had horrible anxiety, panic attacks, paranoia, delusions. I have since come off my anti psychotic medication but effexor has helped me get out of bed, feel happy most days (sometimes you may have an off day), I don't react to stressful situations in the same way I used to (anxiety or panic attacks) and my mood feels more stable. My emotions are no longer unpredictable, I still cry over sad things but I used to cry over anything!!!. I take 300mg, I don't really get any side effects except that it makes me hungry so I have put on a lot of weight but diet and exercise helps combat that and I have just started getting back into this and the weight is coming off. I do get brain zaps if I forget to take it but I put up with them for how amazing this drug has worked for me!

Effexor XR (venlafaxine):Currently coming off these after a few months. I was on another brand for years beforehand.I didn’t have a good experience with Effexor.  I felt numb all the time, I could not laugh or cry !!I stopped enjoying walks with my dog , cooking and went off my food.Basically I felt no joy with anything.I’m doing a very slow decrease from 150mg. Currently on 75.5mg.

I am a 30 year old female. I have been on venlafaxine for several months. Started at 75mg extended release and was doing okay for my mood. However the side effects were bad. Headaches, fatigue,  severe dizziness if you missed just one dose, sweating more, and issues with sex. After a few months I upped the dose to 150mg extended release. This was a mistake. I became unbearably tired. Tired day and night. Also could not sleep for more than 1-2 hours at a time. Pure exhaustion. I than wanted to decrease my dose back to 75mg. I am now at 37.5 mg and taking one every other day to wean off completely. This drug has been a nightmare to get off of. I can see how it works for some but I will never take this medication again.

My doctor keeps telling me to take venlafaxine 150mg  an evening. I sleep until 11am, feel groggy, listless & it takes me about 3hrs to feel normal & motivated. Some people I know take theirs in the morning & suffer with none of this. Anyone else taking their medication am?

Effexor XR (venlafaxine):Please never allow anyone you love to take this drug! Effexor XR has been the worst experience for my husband the past 4 years! He has gone through so many changes, mentally he doesn’t know what is real anymore. What I mean is life, love, emotions, etc. Our marriage was the ideal marriage before he started taken it, but now it has crumbled!  He has been to a mental facility twice on this drug, gone through so many personally changes, it’s unreal! Please do your research before taking this because coming off of it is a living nightmare! I know 2 people who committed suicide on this drug and Thank God I have not lost my husband on it!

Effexor XR (venlafaxine):Took one pill, my first ever anti depressant. Never again. At first just some feeling of euphoria and mild nausea. I was told to expect feeling like a very strong cup of coffee. Ok cool. Then I started to feel my pupils dilate and they felt very strangely warm. Realized I was high as anything and the medication very similar to pain meds-they don’t take the pain away, rather get you high so you don’t care that it hurts. I could see this helping people who struggle to get out of bed or have enough energy, but that is not what I need. Felt like I had taken a tab of E and gone to the club.

This was a positive game changer for me. I have been diagnosed w/ major depression and PTSD. I have also had the Genomind Assay done- I highly recommend this to all individuals seeking help with depression. You can ask your Dr. if he or she will conduct this. It will tell you which medicines are likely to work w/ your genetic profile, so that you do not have to try sequential pharmaceuticals to find the one that works.A lot of depressed patients have a genetic anomaly which prevents their body from producing an enzyme which breaks down B vitamins into energy. (The gene is MTHFR where this genetic variation is.) As such, my Dr. recommended pre-converted B vitamins in the form of L Methyl Folate: https://www.methylpro.com/My Mom & I both take this and it has helped so much!!This psychiatrist recommends supplements: I wish luck & peace to you all!

I was prescribed this for my depression after other antidepressants hadn’t worked. I started on two 37.5mg tablets but it stopped my sleep meds working after a few hours. I was switched to modified release. I noticed side effects: I couldn’t eat as much, I had new coordination issues and I moved even slower. I felt like how drugged people on TV slowly stumble around. There were no benefits for my depression, all I had were side effects. I also noticed PoTS symptoms start, which we’re now investigating.I’d read someone’s account of how it only worked at the highest dose and then was great, so I persisted for months of dosage increases with worsening side effects until I was about to be put on 300mg and I couldn’t cope. Turns out at the highest dose it starts improving dopamine function, and I have ADHD so there are more appropriate meds for that I can try. I’ve been off it for months and still haven’t recovered properly.

After taking SSRI escitalopram for 2 month with not much effect on my problem depression, my NP prescribed me venlafaxine XR 75mg in the morning and 75 mg in the evening.  So far it ha reduced my negative thoughts to some good extent.  I feel calm when I take this medicine and it has helped reducing anxiety to a good extent.  It's effect is just beginning as I am in the 4th week o taking it.  I am not feeling hight and happy.  Maybe the medication is in its initial phase, but my anxiety and negative thoughts are under control to some extent.
Effexor (venlafaxine):The worst withdrawal and side effects of any medication I've ever taken. It's effective but you need to weigh the good with the bad.

Effexor was the first drug that ever worked for me, after years of various therapies, and everything from citalopram to cymbalta to fluoxetine to wellbutrin and everything in between. The first 6 weeks were terrible - no sleep, constant headaches and jitters. THEN, AS IF BY SOME MIRACLE, I REALISED I WAS.. HAPPY. I ate better I went to the gym more I stopped smashing coffee, I got out of bed on time and I smiled at strangers.The only remaining (but fairly terrible) side effect for me was that it completely got rid of my sex drive and ability to orgasm. It's not something I'll be able to stay on long term because of this, but damn, it's helped me get through a tough time.

Effexor (venlafaxine):I'm glad to read these positive reviews because I've been on generic venlafaxine 150mg per day for 8 years. I was on 7 different antidepressants prior to that a year or two each time then the poop out and in to a different one. Venlafaxine has not stopped working. I'm on the highest dose per day slowly increased over a year. My most frustrating side effect is insomnia and some tinnitus. I will also say when my pharmacy changes the pharmaceutical brand of venlafaxine, I have a noticeable couple of days discomfort until I adjust. People understandably tend to be angry about failure or side effect but nothing is worse to me than being disabled by depression.

I got switched from fluoxetine to venlafaxine because my doctors think that I have SSRI resistant depression.Venlafaxine took away the awful gloom of depression but replaced it with feeling completely numb.I've become more suicidal on it because I can't feel any hope or happiness and feel like I'm more likely to act on my suicidal thoughts.My GP won't change it without me seeing a psychiatrist and I can't get an appointment to see a psychiatrist so I've just stopped taking it. The awful depression is back but it's better than the numb void of venlafaxine.

Effexor XR (venlafaxine):I have been on this medication for 7 years, wish my doctor never even suggested it was an available drug. Worst withdrawals I have ever experienced to the point it puts me on my butt if I forgot even a dose, been 9 weeks of strong withdrawals trying to get off of it to switch to new pills…. doesn't make everyday living possible at all. I highly DON'T recommend  this! It should be banned from all states! It is super dangerous drug, coming off it makes you super suicidal and sick to the point you won’t be able to get out of bed

Effexor XR (venlafaxine):I read a lot before taking this medicine because I heard about his horrible side effects and withdrawal symptoms but finally I decided to take it as I believe in all depression medications has side effects and withdrawal symptoms and for sure it won't be worst than depression .And if its approved by FDA and allowed in most of countries, so for sure it has also positive effects more than negative ones. After I took it I felt it change the depression after the first does!and now after 3 months of it, its the best medication I tried till now. But please know it has different effect form person to person. For me side effects was some nausea and night sweating and that was only for one day after that no side effects happened.So finally I tell you don't be afraid to take it -it is safe and strong antidepressant.

Effexor XR (venlafaxine):This medication makes me feel....odd.Been on it for a little over 4 weeks now for bipolar. Get random twitches throughout my body, especially when I'm trying to fall asleep. This never happened before Effexor. Very blunted emotions, which is not something I had with Lexapro or Prozac. I find myself often watching/reading about stirring events just to feel SOMETHING, even if it is negative. Feel extremely lazy (I thought this drug was supposed to help with motivation??) and just want to sleep all day, which is very much NOT like me at all. Has anyone else experienced this with effexor? My doc wants me to give it another couple of weeks, but if I still feel like this by then I am going to request to be put back on Prozac.

Effexor XR (venlafaxine):My GP has just switched me from Lexapro to Effexor-XR. Have been on SSRI's for 10+ years, and have felt they've always provided a "floor," but have gone below the floor for weeks at a time after getting sober 17 months ago. He thinks, because I've been on SSRI's, it could take only a week, not 3, for its effect to become felt. Mainly, just feel a combination of uninterested/tired/down most of the time, so wanted a status check on my meds. We'll see. Wary of the warnings if you don't take it at the same time all the time. Wish all you well!

Didn't feel much negative side effects from getting on it. But I do remember feeling feelings of happiness already within the first week. Feelings of joy that I had forgotten existed. Venlafaxine did effect my sex life though by not being able to reach orgasm for several years. That seemed to be the worst side effect for me plus the always present possibility to forget to take it and therefore go dizzy and unwell within few hours.After 10 years on approximately x 225mg I have now stopped and it took me by surprise just how SICK I became! I stepped out of venlafaxine too fast due to my own impatience and WOW the sickness! Totally dizzy, all sorts of malfunctions, throwing up, very picky with the small amount of food I could bare to even look at, freezing, sweating, emotionally all over the place. After the first 6 days it has begun to get a whole lot better and I am happy to get this far! I believe the medicine helped me when I needed it, but now I am exited to see if I am able to do without on the long run.

I was given venlafaxine and I had all possible side effects. Each of them. I have stopped taking it after years in therapy and on medications. As soon as I stopped, I felt like I was a person again. Venlafaxine took away my life for 6 years and doctors did not believe it was the side effects ruining my life, they believed it was my condition. I am never getting back that time.

Effexor XR (venlafaxine):Have tried several different medications and every supplement including thyroid kelp etc since my three year battle with depression . Effexor didn’t do much for me for about 12-16 weeks I noticed a difference . First 8 weeks I had terrible insomnia I nearly stopped it . Having looked up treatment resistant depression I decided to try taking folate and 6 weeks later it’s the first time I’m feeling 90% myself again . I’m not sure if it’s the Effexor or the folate or both but if your not feeling like the meds are helping 100% I would consider adding folate . Don’t give up

I've been on Venlafaxine for over a year overall its been better than the other antidepressants I've taken.  It helps balance my moods and works well for anxiety the only downsides for me are possibly the influence on my sinuses and gag reflex is heightened.  It is a medication you cannot simply stop quickly.  If coming off reducing by 5-10% less every month is a good way to do it.

Effexor (venlafaxine):Hideous poison. Was on 225mg for eight years. Sweating every night, neurological pain, twitching, shakes....withdrawal symptoms before I was even due my dose. Avoid at all costs. Am now on remeron and I can sleep and function.
Effexor XR (venlafaxine):Very good medication.

Effexor (venlafaxine):Horrible, pure toxic product that will leave you with tics and twitches for the rest of your life, if your doctor prescribes ANYTHING with a black box warning .... BE AWARE !! No black box RX is fit for human consumption, and Remember that the goal of the healthcare industry in the USA  is NOT to make us feel better they like to create other diseases .....all depression drugs related to this one is horrible

Effexor (venlafaxine):so I started taking this drug about 2 weeks ago and have severe depression and anxiety with extreme self esteem issues, and I have been experiencing a lot of different emotions right now. I have a lot of down and depressing moments when I’m alone, to the point where I get panicked about how I’m going to react to certain situations, as I feel like I’m going to over react to the point of snapping at people, especially my family and friends supporting me right now. I have also been having tremors in my legs and my breathing can get out of control at times. Everyone taking new medication will always react differently, and it can take time to settle in but I can honestly say if these symptoms persist, I will be going off this medication. I really hope it starts to kick in a few more weeks time.

Effexor XR (venlafaxine):I took this years ago and checked my journal when a friend mentioned she was starting it and that she was feeling dizzy, to see if this was the one that gave me withdrawals. It was. When I decided to stop taking it it was a nightmare. The brain zaps were unexpected and scary. I felt so sick. After my doctor at the time told me there was no withdrawal, and to just take more instead of less. I was done and decided to find a way to get it out of my system. I had to go to two more new doctors before I found one who believed me and was willing to help me get off of it. The way we did it was switching to Prozac and tapering off of that, because it has a much longer half-life. It was still bad but not as horrible as coming off Effexor.I feel like it took a couple of years after getting off of antidepressants before I started feeling somewhat normal, after being on different ones for over 10 years. Stay away.

Run. As fast as you can from this drug. I had taken it on and off for 20 years since it first came out. I will never touch this medication again. Every time I took it, it helped me out of major depressive episodes, but changed my personality into something totally out of character. This drug has an amphetamine like effect on me. It will make you impulsive and a danger to yourself. Every time I took this medication I abused alcohol, drugs, had irresponsible sexual encounters, and made terrible decisions causing lasting affects on my future. Trying to come off it is then brutal. It takes MONTHS. You will end up breaking open capsules to reduce your dose one single granule at a time. This medication should be banned. Do yourself a favour and try ANYTHING ELSE!!

Effexor (venlafaxine):I love effexor!!!! I have had bi polar depression, extreme depression, cptsd and a lot of anxiety for as long as I can remember. With in a few weeks (I had to start low dose and gradually increase do to bad reactions to most bi polar drugs). So when I got to about 175 mg I started to have no suicidal thoughts AT ALL!! I am so happy to have those thoughts out of my head. I still have some issues but this drug gave me my life back - with no side effects except extreme fatigue until I got used to it. Now I have no tiredness at all. HOWEVER HUGE DISCLAIMER. DO NOT STOP TAKING THIS DRUG EVEN FOR A DAY!!!!! You must wean off this. I actually thought  it was the end of me when I couldn't get my meds for 2 days. I vomited the entire time like couldn't stop. Extreme sweating, hallucinations not severe but still scary. Nightmares and the most painful headache that would not stop. The vomiting was the worst. I wasn't able to hold anything down and I mean extreme cramping of the stomach area. Please be careful.

Effexor XR (venlafaxine):I’ve been on Effexor on and off for years, with a recent six year break from any meds, as well as quitting alcohol two years ago.  In the past Effexor has worked somewhat, with virtually no side effects. A month ago I started on it again. The only side effects in the beginning were decreased appetite and completely taking away my hot flashes.  So I had high hopes. However, this time, by week three my depression had worsened so much I was having more intense suicidal ideation than before I started it - so bad I had to stop. Body chemistry really does change over time. Back to square one.
Enlafax does not work for me been on them about 6 months, feeling really rubbish going back to my doctor today to let him know & see what can be done. Thumbs down for enlafax.

Effexor (venlafaxine):This drug made me want to cut myself! A horrifying thing I would never do! I felt so horrible and disgusted with myself that I actually felt the strong urge to do it! Fortunately I'm very happy that I  succeeded in not doing that terrible thing. I wish complete physical and emotional healing to all those who unfortunately are struggling with such a nightmare. But I did have to hurt myself in other, less violent ways such as hitting. This drug was so so scary that it messed with my mind! This is not who I am! I was acting crazy! And my thoughts and feelings were crazy too crazy and dangerous.  Be very careful! And make sure you are seeing a doctor who really takes the time to listen to you, and wants to help you. They should answer all your questions and have no problem explaining how the drug works and what side effects there might be Also I was only on it for 3 weeks and the withdrawal effects were awful.

I'm not sure if I just tolerate venlafaxine well but I have not noticed anything bad about it. I was nausea the first week of taking it and I do have vivid dreams but it has helped my mood significantly. It's wonderful drug for nonfunctional depression. I no longer have the deep, big feelings of sadness all the time and feel motivated to work towards my goals and valued by my support system. I don't feel superficially happy or too happy. Highly recommend combining it with CBT to get out of an episode of depression. No withdrawal symptoms when I've missed doses either.

This is the second time I've been on the medication venlafaxine. The first couple of weeks are difficult, I personally felt wired, struggled with sleep, loss of appetite and sexual side effects etc, but importantly they all passed as I got better and my body adjusted. Coming off is easy enough, just go very slowly. I've been on a number of different medications for mental health issues over the last 4 years, and for me, venlafaxine is one of the better ones to be on, but everyone is different. If like me, you're scrolling through these reviews, wondering if you're on the right medication for you, my best advise is to stop and see a psychiatrist. GPs will have their go to medications but it's not their specialism and more often than not they'll prescribe the same/cheapest medication for a whole host of mental health issues. Don't sell yourself short - see a specialist and remember it might get worse before it gets better. Good luck!
Effexor XR (venlafaxine):Effexor XR caused me to develop dangerously high blood pressure so I had to come off them. The withdrawals were horrendous.

After many years of suffering and much research, I decided I should try venlafaxine for my depression - which took the form, almost exclusively, of a terrible morning hopelessness and dread.  I had read the venlafaxine was a class of antidepressant that somehow worked well for that particular manifestation, and also that it achieved good results in my age group - middle aged/menopausal women.  I am happy to report an excellent result with complete resolution to the morning dread!  I wouldn't say that I'm entirely out of some level of depression, but that symptom is gone, and what a relief.  Highly recommend!

Struggled with major depression and panic-like anxiety since 17 years old. I am now 28 and have been off medications for about 4 years and have recently found it’s time to get back on, and stay on. Two weeks ago I started citalopram but broke out in a rash on my ears and neck almost instantly and it lasted for 3 days so I obviously had an allergic reaction and stopped taking it. It is 4:30am right now and 2 nights ago I started taking Effexor 37.5mg. Last night I felt so nauseous and my headache was probably a 7/10. My fault for not taking this with food. However, the nausea and headache dissipated and I have pretty much been awake all night feeling like a crackhead. Tired as can be yet laying here. Jawing at my teeth. Jittery. So uncomfortable. Feel uncomfortable even going into work in 2 1/2 hours and praying these symptoms are subsided by then. Not sure if this is the one for me- don’t think I could deal with these symptoms for another day.

Effexor (venlafaxine):5 weeks in on Effexor and up to 112mg. Sleeping better. Fatigued through the day. Have to motivate myself to do things but fine when I do it. Mental tasks are more draining. Exchanged anxiety for lethargy. Hoping this will lift as the weeks go on. On the whole a positive for me.

Oh dear, I have just taken a first dose and was vomiting half an hour later. Feel awful like my blood sugars have dramatically dropped. Feel restless, hot and cold. Never felt so strange of medication. I was previously on mirtazapine they was great until the night sweats after a few years. Think I will have to give these new ones a miss I can’t be a mum or a nurse feeling like that.

Effexor XR (venlafaxine):In a few paragraphs, I can gladly proclaim this medication saved my life in sooo many ways! I had never felt content until I took Effexor. The grass was greener, the music was even more beautiful, I am now kind and patient again; I am simply happy! I don't need to constantly seek out pleasurable things to make life more exciting anymore. I’m not so emotionally vulnerable. For the first time in my life,  I can READ! My ADHD has diminished 70% - 90%!Whether it be from ADHD, anhedonia or both, I can FINALLY enjoy the simple things in life.Lastly and miraculously, my IQ went up 15 - 20 points! My thought process is much more clear, and I LOOOVE reading and learning! My new-found curiosity fuels my joy for living and learning. I want to thank the people who created this drug. I am not only myself again, but I’m someone I never even knew I was capable of being!

Effexor (venlafaxine):I'm on Effexore for Depression, Anxiety, ADHD.1-4 WeeksThe medication the first few weeks is going to make you excessively sleepy. It is just the nature of the beast. During the first few weeks ensure that you are taking the time to get a work out in a few times a week and supplement any lethargy with a bit of caffeine. Weeks 5-8This is where the medication really starts to shine. If you are a male, this drug is ideal for you because it has a less likely chance of causing erectile dysfunction as it is a SRNI and not a SSRI. Your reaction to negative events, to include stressful situations, begins to dramatically change. Instead of having fast paced thoughts, you have a true sense of peace, less worry and a newfound sense of over all well-being. I highly recommend this medication if your SSRI is causing you ED, you suffer from anxiety, ADHD, OCD, or depression.

I venlafaxine  took this from age 23-27(or 28, can't remember)Positive Effect: it will remove anxiety because it will remove  your feelingsSide Effects:-it will destroy you testosterone for the rest of your life-will remove all motivation-gynocomastia-can't have sex-can't have a relationship-gaining a lot of weight, even if you always been thin.-apathy-tiredness, you Will be sluggish -sleep for 10 hours easily and cant work half as good as before-your emotions will be almost none-if you stop you will have symptoms for a year at least, zaps, tiredness, diarrhea, self confidence, you Will have less sensitivity in your dick for the rest of your lifeThe list can go on forever.

I think I've missed a period after doubling my dose from 75mg to 150mg per day. Either that or I'm pregnant. Anyone else had mixed up menstruation from Venlafaxine? Apart from that I've been very exhausted and sleeping loads but it's lifting a bit now after being on 150mg for 3 weeks. Came off it during lockdown as there was nothing un my life to make me anxious. Slowest ever tapering. Literally crumbing up the pills to swallow bits to avoid the brain shivers :-( misery coming off them otherwise

I used venlafaxine for more than a year to treat severe depression. Mostly I used 150mg. Tried 375mg for 3 months but was so tired with low mood, decreasing the dosage helped me. It reduced my depression symptoms. I started to feel stable ok without thinking of suicide every day after 6 month of taking venlafaxine. But it made my emotions flat and got rid of motivation so it was hard to push myself to do daily activities. Also I had excessive sweating, my clothes were completely wet after even short walk.

I took this venlafaxine for 3 years starting 2016, then it seemed to bottom out when some traumatic events took place. It was life saving before that. I stopped taking it (tapered off, because you have to - but if you do it right it’s not that bad) due to not wanting to increase dosage anymore, plus I was having night sweats and vivid nightmares. I tried a couple of other medications but nothing made me feel as functional and able to do life the way venlafaxine did. I am now going back on it and looking forward to getting rid of the crippling anxiety and depression. In hindsight, the night sweats aren’t so bad compared to the anxiety/depression. This medication is the only one that helped me to feel normal, less worried about trivial things, able to get out of bed in the morning and participate in social life and work. It’s true that you have to give it a little time and make sure you take it at the same time daily, don’t miss a dose or it will definitely mess with you.

This drug venlafaxine has changed my life and given me my life back, I am the most confident I have ever been, at work I am public speaking I am having less panic attacks and anxiety.  My work have noticed my confidence.  I am back to the confident person I was 20 years ago.

Effexor XR (venlafaxine):Started taking effexor in the luteal phase of my period (approx 10 days before menstruation) Premenstrual dysphoric disorder and it has CHANGED MY LIFE. I feel the best I've felt. I cannot even access the dark and awful thoughts/insecurities/self-loathing that used to be a constant during this period. Only side effects I've felt was a slight bit of nausea/ light headedness in the first few days and difficulty sleeping (I keep waking up at 6am, but feel pretty refreshed so it's okay). Will report back on how it feels to go off them at the end of this phase.
been on venlafaxine for 2 weeks I really feel a lot better its amazing

Effexor XR (venlafaxine):Please remember to give Effexor XR a couple of months to work. The first month or even two are going to suck. Why? Remember that the chemicals in your brain are adjusting. We have a chemical imbalance. Be patient and kind to yourself. I was on Lexapro and it worked but I gained so much weight so I got off. Not a good idea. Never just go cold turkey! So, after speaking to my doctor he put me on Effexor and it has been such a blessing. I’m on 225mg for over 3 years and while I do have good and bad days because it’s not a miracle pill, you still have to fight the depression and anxiety but it helps you fight it. Stay strong! It works. Be patient. Don’t be scared.
Terrible drug. Crashed my mood and made me apathetic. Was on 75mg for 7 weeks, 150mg was way too much as it is. Don't take this. I advise taking an older drug like Imipramine or Amitryptiline.

Effexor (venlafaxine):From my experience Effexor is a very effective treatment for depression and anxiety. I took it  for 10 years at a dose of 150mg and felt great. I stopped 3 months ago and already depression is returning, so today I'm going back on! Yes the side effects can be grim but for me it was only when being late with dose or quitting. But overall I think its worth it for not having to suffer depression and anxiety everyday!

Effexor (venlafaxine):Took 75 mg Effexor for 21 years. Dr said to come off and for 6 weeks I weaned off of this hard to quit drug. So now I stop taking it and 8 days later I'm still having the brain zaps. If you start taking it be prepared to experience a living nightmare if you want to quit. It did nothing to help me.

Effexor XR (venlafaxine):I don’t have any symptoms of anxiety usually - but experienced what feeling anxious was like within the first few days of taking this medication Effexor XR. For me, this was a good sign early on, and trusted that the anxious feeling would subside within the coming days. The anxiousness went away quite quickly, however I began averaging around 13 hours of sleep a day. I persisted despite the extreme lethargy, taking this medication for 4 weeks. I feel like I wasted a month of my life on this medication, I didn’t feel hunger, however still needed food to stay awake, so didn’t enjoy eating as much but ate the same amount - if not more sugar to try and compensate for the tiredness. I was hoping for the opposite effect, so naturally I was disappointed. It completely got rid of my sex drive. I have since switched back to Lexapro which has helped slightly in the past, I am hoping to find the best combo for me in the future. Am seriously considering asking for Dexedrine at this point.

Effexor XR (venlafaxine):I was on Effexor XR for a few months and ended up stopping it around 1 year ago because the only thing it did was barely keeping me alive, that's about it. I have C-PTSD, MDD and ASD. Feeling nauseous all the time, no emotions at all except vague sadness. Then I started taking it again a few months ago because I had another MDD episode. This time the side effects were even worst. I gained 15 pounds in 3 months, I spent my entire days in bed completely numb. I had nightmares and at some point it got so bad that I was sleeping 20 hours a day. I didn't have anxiety attacks in years and started to have them again. It's a pretty rough price to pay not to feel suicidal. A doctor switched me to Fetzima 2 weeks ago and I already feel so much better. Better than I've been in years in fact. I know Venlafaxine works for some people, but for me it was the worst antidepressant I've ever had in my life. The 2/10 is for keeping me alive for a few weeks, otherwise I'd give it 1/10

Effexor XR (venlafaxine):I was put on a starting dose of 75 mg Effexor XR and worked my way up to  a dose of 150 mg. I couldn't sleep and my mind was racing. I wasn't myself at all. Back on 75 mg now and I feel better than that but still depressed. Switching meds soon I hope.
I was on venlafaxine for about 8 months it had zero effekt on me. So one day i stopped taking it. I was really scared of the crazy withdrawel symptoms but i did not get any.
Diarrhea diarrhea diarrhea diarrhea!

Stay away from this drug venlafaxine,  that is all I can say. It took away years of my 20’s and made me a zombie, it didn't even work for me, in fact it made my depression worse. It was a pure nightmare to go through withdrawal, got brain zaps and felt like my brain was on fire for a long time. It was easier to quit benzo addiction and opiate addiction than quitting this horrible drug.

Effexor XR (venlafaxine):I had severe anxiety in 2016, it was truly crippling. Along with panic attacks and thinking I was dying all the time, I experienced depersonalization/derealization every day. Effexor XR truly saved my life. I take my pills at night, and if I miss one dose, I know immediately the next day by how I feel. It’s a horrible feeling. I also described it as my head was skipping, but I see others describe it as brain zaps. That’s truly what it feels like. Besides that though, this medication changed everything for me.

I had the worst time being on venlafaxine medication. I am a 28 years old F who has suffered from depression and anxiety for many years. I have been on and off medications. After years of trying to defeat it by myself without help, I sought medical guidance. My doctor prescribed this drug. When she upped the dose to 75 mg, I felt like a zombie. I gave this medication a chance, I tried to, I took it for about 2 months. I was in a constant daze, the sexual side effects sucked and I did not feel like myself at all. I was always tired and worst of all, my sleep was impacted. I never used to tremble in my sleep until I started this awful medication. My husband would wake me up because of my constant trembling and nightmares. The withdrawal effects are not pleasant. If it helps you and you’ve been on it awhile, great. Personally, I feel Venlafaxine made my situation worse. I have been off the medication for a week now and I feel 10 times better, more like myself.

Venlafaxine is the absolute worst medication I have ever been on. I was put on it about a year ago for my depression and anxiety. Not only have I still struggled with both....I have had the WORST side effects. Over the course of time (the past year) the side effects are worsening. Nightmares, night sweats, constant nausea, vomiting, stomach issues, headaches, dry mouth....I have never had such a terrible experience, never again.

I was prescribed this drug venlafaxine for depression, after 10 years of menopausal symptoms. I took it for about 2 years. I noticed side effects if I was late with the dose... but when I came off it, it was truly appalling. Some three years later, I still get the sweats, the odd brain flash now... but it has left me with permanent tinnitus. It's fine whilst you're on it, but a vile, and in my case, permanent damage occurs when you come off it. My advice? Do your homework, because your doctor just ain't interested in the withdrawal... they're only interested, whilst you're actually on it!

Effexor XR (venlafaxine):Effexor  was by far the worst medication I have taken. If you miss even 1 dose within hours you are sick and having withdrawal symptoms. It took a good 6 months before the brain zaps stopped. Run away. It's terrible.

Effexor XR (venlafaxine):My neurologist prescribed me Effexor XR for nerve pain. I had a head injury from a car accident and have been suffering from facial nerve pain, neck injury, and depression. This drug has improved my quality of life. I highly recomend it for nerve pain. I started out taking 37.5mg for a month. Then, 75mg. The 75mg dose works for me. It took 6 weeks for me to feel the benefits.

I was put on venlafaxine in 2001, and soon became functionally narcoleptic and severely depressed. Over the years, doctors kept increasing the dosage, telling me I was simply very ill and needed a high dose of venlafaxine just to make my depression manageable. Finally, after 17 years, and several failed attempts to taper off, I stopped my venlafaxine cold turkey against medical advice. Coming off this drug was possibly the most difficult thing I've ever done, with truly horrific withdrawal symptoms, but once I made it through those months of withdrawal and recalibration, I learned that all those years, it was the venlafaxine that had been making me ill. As a minor effect, I lost 10 pounds within my first month of stopping the venlafaxine. More importantly, I went from needing 12 hours sleep per day to 7.5 hours sleep per day, and my depression lifted. That was over a year ago, and this past year has been my healthiest in two decades. After 17 years, I finally have my life back.

Effexor XR (venlafaxine):I have only been taking Effexor for a little over 2 months and noticed that if I was even an hour late taking my daily dose I’d feel nauseous and anxious.  I also began to notice that I was feeling nauseous anytime I didn’t have a full stomach, so weight gain was inevitable. I decided this drug was making my physical symptoms seriously distressing enough to outweigh any good it may be doing.  I was shocked at how awful the withdrawal symptoms have been even though I was  only on it for two months at a dose of 75mg.  I’ve been experiencing nausea and brain zaps for two weeks now. My GP put me on Effexor, but after meeting a psychiatrist at a dinner function & casually asking her thoughts on Effexor she said she doesn’t prescribe it, its withdrawal is so awful. I’m glad I’m getting off it, but alarmed at how nasty the withdrawal is, can't imagine how bad withdrawal would be for those at a higher dosage and for much longer than my 2 months.

Effexor (venlafaxine):WORST 48hrs of my entire life. First day I took it Effexor (dose 37.5mg) with my 300mg of Wellbutrin and I got to work and couldn’t even walk in a straight line. Went home and figured maybe I just shocked my system and slept it off.  Next day I took the same dosage.First came the spaced out phase where I couldn’t remember where I was or what I was doing. The tremors? So violent that I couldn’t walk or talk or hold things. My husband came home to find me in the fetal position on the floor shaking violently. Let’s not forget hearing and seeing things that weren’t there. Another thing I noticed was that one second I was laughing then the next crying. It was so scary and I couldn’t stop it from happening. Stopped taking it. It’s been 2 days now and I still have tremors. Can’t eat. And the only thing that will stop the tremors is 1mg of Ativan. This drugs ruined my life in 48hrs. I will never recommend it to anyone. Worst 2 days of my life and it’s still going.

Effexor XR (venlafaxine):I have been on Celexa in the past and had done well on it until the last few months, so my therapist recommended that I be switched to something else. Effexor XR was suggested as part of my treatment plan. For the first two weeks, I was on 37.5 milligrams + 10 milligrams of Citalopram and seemed to do well on it. After that, I was supposed to double the dosage up to 75 milligrams. When I doubled the dosage, my body had horrible side effects: I missed a full week of work; I was not sleeping; I was sweating in my sleep; I was starting to argue with my fiance over stupid things; and it caused suicidal ideation. I ended up in the hospital, missed more work, back at the hospital again trying to seek more treatment, and had to see my therapist twice in one week demanding a new medication. I have been off of this medication for a week and have been on Paxil (a drug that is in the same family as Citalopram) and have been doing well - like much, much better.

Effexor XR (venlafaxine):Withdrawal is the worst.  These drugs rob you of life's pleasures for sure. Only take the drugs after you try nutrition, exercise, meditation, any great behavioral techniques. Take it to stay alive only. Pray unceasing for another method that helps more. I moved away from a violent area which helped me greatly. I am well and happy now in Oklahoma.
This medication is saving my life!!! It has made me feel great while managing my depression and anxiety. Before the meds, I wanted to commit suicide!! I am so grateful for this medication!

Effexor XR (venlafaxine):I take 150mg time released effexor, I am dealing with a head injury for 6 months now. I have been on Effexor since. I have no side effects and it has really helped me with my anxiety, nervousness and depression.  This medicine is such a life saver, I can go to work and be around people. I don’t know where I would be without this medication.

I absolutely HATE this med venlafaxine.  I was on a dose of  225mg -  a 150 mg and a 75 mg taken together.Was NOT helping, med nurse on vacay, I tried to wean down to 150 per day for 3 weeks, then 75 for another 2 weeks--Went absolutely shoe throwing crazy!!Sooooo- back on 150 mg a day-- nurse said, "A lot of medical personnel will not prescribe, because it is so difficult to get off. "  gee thanks-- so I guess I take it forever and it doesn't help??

Effexor XR (venlafaxine):My brain zaps are not brief or jolting. They are the worst headache if my life lasting hours, waking me from sleep, unable to speak, move, any eye movement increases the pain tenfold. Today I had so much pain I was nauseous. Once it was so bad I couldn't speak. Taking effexor xr 150 qd. setting up an appointment with a psychiatrist who specialized in transcranial magnetic therapy, ketamine and other advanced therapies to get off this stufffemale, age 55, on effexor 1.5 yrs for depression, social anxiety.

I took Venlafaxine 75mg twice in my life, I took it for a year in 2018 and back to it at the end of 2019, the first time taking it was hard because of the side effects, no appetite, libido is gone and headaches and vomiting, after two weeks it get so much better, so keep trying it and don't give up because after a while side effects are gone. The first time taking it was very good, helped me a lot, much better than the previous med that I was taking (fluoxetine 20mg). after at the end of 2019 I had to start taking it again and on the first weeks it was okay, it helped me for around 3 months but then I got worst, apparently my body was tired of the chemicals and now I changed to a new antidepressant, lets try it ... Do not give up on venlafaxine it was really good and helpful for me, don't be harsh  on yourself and be strong with the side effects because it is just on the first days .. Good luck to everyone who is reading this .. <3

Effexor XR (venlafaxine):I originally started on the regular effexor when I was 16 after a suicide attempt while on prozac. This was literally a life saver for me! Switched to XR when it became available. I was on it for about 3 yrs, before deciding I no longer wanted to be anchored down by antidepressants. The withdrawals sucked...but didn't last long. I'm considering going back on it and am now 37 yrs old.

I was on venlafaxine just a month for depression, decided to come off of it due to side effects of feeling like a zombie, I have had severe nausea and throwing up and dirrhea, stay clear of this drug it’s not worth it!

Effexor XR (venlafaxine):Everyone's different, for me this one's a LIFE SAVER! My depression began 15yrs ago. In 2014 I hit my lowest point. Previous dr had me on several meds that didn't mix well together. That whole year is a blur, I don't remember any of it except for the few grand mal seizures they caused. Eventually attempted suicide with one of the meds and ended up in a mental hospital twice within a month. My new psychiatrist took me off everything and started me on this, topped out at 150mg (which I am to this day, 6yrs later, still taking). I can't thank that psychiatrist and this miracle drug enough. Taking with Bupropion (Wellbutrin) and I'm not sure which one, but I believe one of them has got rid of my sex drive. I prefer no sex drive over that really dark place I was in. Also, if I miss taking them a couple of days in a row (again, not sure which one is causing it) I experience extreme vertigo.. not fun. Other than that, I have no other complaints just absolute gratefulness. LOVE IT!

I’ve been taking Venlafaxine maybe a year now, I say maybe because I’m never quite sure of anything at all anymore. I apologise to everyone and everything profusely! My inability to sit still or quit tapping my feet is torture I have brain shocks almost everyday! They sometimes last for hours leaving me incapable of working or being.Being? Yes meaning if I have a bad episode that I’ve forgotten to take my meds per say I will almost have to lock myself in a dark room and cradle my knees , weeping , aggravated , pulling my hair out , scratching my arms , being rude to those around me all in all I turn into a crazy woman!Back to the forgetfulness has anyone ever told you that Ven XL cause forgetfulness and confusion , also nausea drowsiness, suicidal thoughts, in fact all this medication has done for me is driven my mind into a careless unloving state ? Just simply mad. My advice stay well clear!

After trying many antidepressants this one venlafaxine had the biggest impact and least nasty side effects such as tiredness, weight gain, acne, bloating which I have had on other medication. Stick with it though nothing is gonna happen overnight.

I've been taking antidepressants for 18 years (I'm 34 now) and none of them have compared to Effexor. I have severe depression, PMDD, Panic Disorder, PTSD, Fibromyalgia, Insomnia, and SAD. I don't think I'd be alive if I hadn't been taking this medication for the last ten years. I know the biggest complaints are weight gain and the withdrawal symptoms, but please don't let these dissuade you from trying everything you can to get better. My father was able to quit Effexor without any side effects after two years use. Whereas I experience side effects rapidly. They're uncomfortable, but I see them as a reminder to take my medication.Obviously, this does not cure all my problems, but I'd rather be chubby and a little spacey than suicidal. It's also given me such a great outlook that dealing with a chronic pain disorder is easier than it would be if I were not in Effexor. I believe I'll be on this medication my whole life, but at least I have my life.Keep your heads up!

I was prescribed this for depression and overall anxiety. I’ve dealt with a lot over the past few months so I finally went in to get some help. Doc prescribed 37.5 mg since I asked for the lowest dose. I used to take sertraline (Zoloft) so I know how sensitive my system can be. This was literally the scariest health experience I’ve ever had. I took it at 3:30 pm, started out well, went to bed at 10 and woke up at 3 am with the worst headache, vertigo, nausea, shakes and weird tingling all over my body. I couldn’t eat all day (gagging at the thought of food), sweating and not being able to do ANYTHING but lay down next to my baby. This was a terrible experience for me. I almost called the ambulance since I thought I might be dying. I felt like I had poisoned myself.  I called my doc and she prescribed a different med but after last night I think I’ll pass. No medicine is worth taking with those kind of side effects. Please be careful with this medicine.

I have been on venlafaxine for a little over a month now. My first 30 days I was on a dose of 37.5 mg daily and I didn't have any crazy side effects, just a little more tired at night like my body knows to shut down. One other thing I've notice my loss of appetite one day I went 17 hours without eating and didn't even notice. I work in medical so I'm always moving. I noticed on the 37.5mg dose my anxiety was still in panic mode every once in a while so at my 30 day follow up I went up to 75mg and so far just my appetite is gone and I'm calm like I usually can go from 0 to a million real quick but I'm calm.  I've had situations lately that could've set me off but I remained calm. So far on this med pretty good for me!

Effexor XR (venlafaxine):Have taken Prozac, Zoloft, bupropion XR on and off over the years. Nothing has snapped me out of a major depression episode quicker than this Effexor. Already take 80mg strattera for ADD. Venlafaxine kicked in almost immediately and has been tremendously helpful. I have read all the horror stories about going off of it but I was desperate for relief and this really did the trick. I don't want to be on it forever tho.

Astonishingly venlafaxine is effective even at it's lowest dose initially..Initially...The step up to 150mgs was helpful a little time passes and dosage increased to 225mg and then progresses on to 375mg. At 225mg the drug was far less effective at 375mg I was persistently suicidal and suffered horrible anxiety and it had a very negative impact on my digestive system. Withdrawal just about as totally horrible as many people describe. Conclusion: At low to moderate doses up to an absolute maximum of 225mg over short periods of time a generally helpful drug. Don't even entertain an increase beyond 225mg the journey from that point for many people is not remotely something you would wish to engage with..Ever !

Effexor XR (venlafaxine):This drug is by far the best anti depression meds I’ve taken and I’ve been on since age 17 (now 34) of you miss a day you will be very emotional but other than that I haven’t noticed many bad side effects. My depression is great now and has been for year the only negative is my lack in sex drive and sleeping a lot. Not sure if that’s all the meds or just my lazy arse. Heard a lot of bad reviews but honestly I’ve been on it for 7 years and I think it’s great.

Effexor XR (venlafaxine):Tired Effexor for PMDD mainly irritability and depression around period. No initial side effects (likely because I switched to it after not being able to tolerate Celexa).  Started having night sweats. Stayed on for 6 weeks and don't feel it was helping and couldn't tolerate the night sweats so switched again (to Paxil) and doing well so far. Everyone responds differently need to stick it out to find what works for you.

Effexor XR (venlafaxine):I have been on Effexor XR for about ten years.  I am moderate bi-polar depressive (per two doctors).  I went off the medication after about two years - long time ago. Was okay for a while, and then my depression came roaring back.  My doctor put me back on with 25 mg first, 50 mg and then 75 mg per day.  Also taking lithium carbonate - three pills per day.  I feel better 95% of the time.   Some days, I feel the lows, but they are not as bad.

Have done well with generic Effexor ER for depression for years. My pharmacy switched manufacturer to Aurobindo venlafaxine ( generic )   Things started slowlyGoing downhill after they switched. I’m very suspicious that these generic drug makers are completely unregulated As to where they get their ingredients. Have read many problems with their quality. Going to ask my pharmacy for another supplier. Even my doctor told me that he is not a fan of drugs from India.
