I am on my second week of 75mg . I am constantly dizzy and nauseaus. When does it go away?

Twenty years of feeling like I wasn't getting anywhere. Wanted to cut the meds but psychiatrist was unable to have an adult conversation when I dared question her. As a result did it anyway. My own way slowly. Don't just stop these. You will feel messed up if you do. A year later, I have my minimal base dose, I'm not fixed and have ups and downs but I feel like myself again and not a zombie in limbo somewhere.

Effexor (venlafaxine):I've been on Effexor for 3 or 4 months. So far I've noticed things are more pleasurable and I have a tiny bit more energy. Still have depressed days though.As for the anxiety... still there, and hasn't improved much. Panic attacks aren't as frequent or intense. But still get them.My anxiety is so bad it's to the point I can barely leave the house unless I really have to.If you're on this drug, you're going to want to stay on it and make sure you don't skip doses. I get major withdrawal symptoms like extreme dizziness, headaches. Make sure you ween off it.Overall, still depressed and definitely still anxious. The effects of relief are mild and sometimes hard to notice. I still rate it a 7 because if it has helped anything it's the panic attacks which are easily the worst mental experience you can go through aside from being tortured to death. It's very tormentuous.But because Effexor hasn't relieved much else, I'd consider trying something new.

I was diagnosed with depression and was prescribed venlafaxine and found that I had so many side effects, bad headaches, nausea, suicidal, self harming and the list goes on, it made my depression worse. I wouldn’t recommend this drug to anyone.

venlafaxine was the worst decision of my life. Started it at 9pm, got diarrhea at 11pm. Thought nothing of it. Went to bed. Woke up at 2am and with the most severe nausea/ restlessness/ and tingling all over my body. Managed to fall asleep at 330am after walking outside for an hour. Woke up feeling absolutely manic. I was pacing for hours, pupils dilated, sweating profusely, restless as can be, yet somehow tired and sleepy, feeling absolutely crazy for 2 days. And this is all from one 75mg tablet Wish I could give this one a 0

Effexor (venlafaxine):I was diagnosed with depression and GAD about 5 years ago and started Effexor. It worked well but anytime I drank alcohol I become a monster. I became violent and angry. I also lost the ability to sleep so I had to go on another medication for insomnia. Over time I realized I had become numb. I couldn't cry, feel any emotions and I lost the ability to enjoy anything. My panic attacks became debilitating. I became fearful to leave the house, drive etc. I ended up in the hospital and I was immediately taken off Effexor because i was diagnosed with panic disorder and it was not helping at all. I was at the highest dose and eventually came off. I'm still experiencing brain zaps from tapering off but since coming off I can feel again and cry a lot LOL. I started Zoloft today and am hoping to get my depression & panic disorder under control!
Withdrawal symptoms were too unbearable for me and took mere hours to come on. Asked my psych to taper me off of this and I won't be looking back.

Effexor XR (venlafaxine):PLEASE, PLEASE, PLEASE take my advice. If Effexor is working for you, don't quit! I took Effexor for 8 great years (anxiety and depression). Tapered and quit. Started again two months later to be on the safe side while going through a stressful period at work. Within 24 hours my life fell totally apart. Anxiety and depression through the roof. 18 months and 4 AD's later I am still a wreck. Losing hope.

I was diagnosed manic depressive when I was younger. The doctors gave me Paxil, nortriptyline , Prozac, lexepro, but Effexor XR is the only one that helped me. Now I ask my doctor years later when I’m having these same manic depression issues and they won’t prescribe me it. They want to try other ones, and I’m done trying other ones. Paxil wouldn’t let me cry, the emotions were there with no release. Nortriptyline made me so angry and caused stomach problems. Prozac made me feel like a freakin zombie, and lexapro did nothing at all. Effexor xr worked, my head felt clear, my thoughts weren’t all over the place, and I felt like me again. So why won’t my doctor give me this relief?
Effexor XR (venlafaxine):My head is exploding! What is this drug?

Absolutely awful drug! Worst one I've tried so far in 6 years of depression and anxiety. I've only been taking them for 6 weeks. Sleep eludes me every single day, yet I'm so, so tired. I'm constantly nauseous, I've gone fat despite not being hungry or eating much, I'm not motivated at all, I feel "detached" all the time and withdrawals if I forget to take one are horrendous! I'm reduced to a blubbering, quivering wreck! I also keep getting full body "pulses" of numbness/tingling since taking these. If your doctor offers these to you, point blank refuse them!

Effexor XR (venlafaxine):Our son 16 yrs old was put on Effexor xr, in January 2019 for depression , after prozac wasn't working on him. The dose was slowly increased to 225mg, at the time his psychiatrist went on holiday and he developed dilated pupils, racing heart, jiggling, sweating, took him to the GP who immediately took an ECG, reduced his meds, said that he was developing seretonin syndrome. The psychiatrist did not have a replacement while away and had planned to add another antidepressant as effexor wasn't working. The reduction side effects have been horrible, made more manageable by using micronutrients but still losing a lot of school time. From August to December we have gone down from 225mg to 42, reductions have become smaller and slower as the dose reduces. Nausea, vomiting, dizziness, head zaps, fatigue, insomnia are his side effects. I wish I had done more homework. Since reading more, using it on under 18 is not recommended.
Effexor XR (venlafaxine):This antidepressant saved my life!  I’ve been taking this for at least 2 years and I haven’t noticed any side effects.
Effexor XR (venlafaxine):do not take this drug long term.... 20 years down the line when your lymph nodes start to swell you will remember this warning.

Effexor XR (venlafaxine):This stuff is AWFUL. Feels like MDMA but with only the bad effects. Jaw clenching, can't focus, nausea, shaking. I was literally scared. I called the advice nurse after trying to make myself throw it up because I felt so terrible. Stay AWAY from this drug.

Effexor XR (venlafaxine):31/m. I have been on Effexor XR generics for 5 years after nearly committing suicide at the age of 26. It has completely gotten rid of my suicidal ideation as well as tremendously reducing my depression and anxiety. Without it, I'm quite certain that I would not be alive today.  After trying to get off of it a couple times and having those bad feeling come back, I have become resigned to the fact that I will likely be on this drug for life, but am okay with that to be honest. I don't really have any side effects from the drug, at least not that I am aware of. The reason I give it 8 stars is because if you ever DO want to get off of it, the withdrawal symptoms are absolutely horrendous.

Effexor XR (venlafaxine):I was using Prozac and my Dr changed me to Effexor XR started with 75mg and up to 150mg and it been much better. I still have my moments of anxiety and sleeping but with other medication help me with both.. Without Effexor I get to emotional and super depressed.

Effexor XR (venlafaxine):This medication needs to be illegal. It did not help my depression, it caused significant weight gain, and if a dose was missed by 1+ hours, the side effects were severe. The withdrawal symptoms are more intense than I ever would have imagined and prescribing doctors do not warn patients against this. After beginning to taper off this medication, I experienced really dark thoughts and attempted suicide. I was in the ICU for a week and a psychiatric hospital for 4 weeks. Effexor almost cost me my life. Please don't risk yours by taking it.

10 year relationship finished by ex by a text cried and cried everyday for for 6 months !! Started taking venlafaxine  at a dose of 75mg slow release 4 days a go and can not believe the difference in myself I’m happy I’m full of the old me already.They are amazing and I’m a pharmacy technician and have been for 20 years ! Slow release tablets have a lot less side effects than instant release
First few days I felt like I was tripping but after that went away it's been amazing. Withdrawal is awful but if you can take it on time this drug has saved my life.

I'm only on day 3 of taking venlafaxine sr, I was suicidal and deeply depressed. I had tried others like lexapro and similar, some worked but the side effects were horrible and made me gain weight. Since starting venlafaxine I feel 90% better, no increase in appetite, and only mild side effects like being jittery and dry mouth. I also have severe anxiety and it hasn't worsened it at all.
Effexor XR (venlafaxine):Effexor gave me debilitating constant head pressure and back pain. Stay away from this rubbish! It should be illegal!

I started taking venlafaxine 3 years ago in November, I was having a very rough time at work, felt sad, stressed, no motivation, it was the worst November in my life...Right after taking my first dose I felt a sudden rush of energy but found that after an hour of being on my feet, I had to sit down as I felt breathless. I kept taking it and found it great for improving my mood, however with time the side effects seemed just too much (loss of libido, lack of energy, tiredness, nightmares). Started to come off it very gradually, and yet the withdrawal symptoms were just terrible, I managed to get to a point where I was feeling fine taking the lowest dose every second day (took me about 4 months) when my doctor recommended increasing the dose again after having IBS from the stress starting new job. Now I'm on the lowest dose again and planning to switch to prozac very. I'm sick of being a zombie on a couch, not wanting to socialise, exercise etc

This medicine has not been effective. I’ve experienced convulsions when I’m anxious that I can’t control. My anxiety has become much worse. Although the depression improved for the first month, I experienced severe apathy where nothing seemed to matter. After the first month, my depression and anxiety worsened significantly. I spend at least one day a week so low I can’t leave my room. Although this medication may be effective for some, it hasn’t been effective in my case. I’ve never felt as bad as I currently do, even before treatment.

Effexor XR (venlafaxine):Zoloft stopped working for me so I switched to Effexor XR and the results are amazing. That and gabapentin has alleviated my depression and anxiety. I feel so much better. Downside is not to miss a dose or you feel it!

Effexor XR (venlafaxine):These pills are horrible. The lights are so much brighter now. I always feel sick to my stomach. I have no motivation to do anything. I wake up 5-6 times a night having cold sweats. I always feel exhausted. My hands and feet are constantly sweating. Do not take this drug. The withdrawals are atrocious

I have had depression for 15+ years and have been on and off several anti-depressants; venlafaxine is the only one which has helped me cope. It's hard getting on and off it. The withdrawal is bad for me if I forget to take it, but I am on 350mg so I guess it would be. Like with all meds, go see your doctor. I had liver function probs, so had to come off it for a time and they step withdrew it, (25mg reduction every few days) and it wasn't really that bad except for worsening mood. Once sorted, I went back on it. Again starting on venlafaxine isn't great, every increase of meds gives me a headache/nausea/sleeplessness/jitters but this stops after a day or two. I'm still depressed on it but I rarely cut myself any more (used to be several times a month), I can get up for work and cope pretty well. I only get really dark a couple of times a month and I can usually ride it. For me it's like an umbrella, the rain is still pouring but I'm not as wet through.

I hope this helps someone else. Do not be scared of coming off this drugv enlafaxine. I am doing it right now, and I'm okay.I was on 150mg venlafaxine for 8 months and it absolutely helped me out of a very bad state of mind. In the last 6 months I've joined a gym, started Keto diet, and meditation. Because let's face it, taking anti depressants and hoping for a sparkling,  personality while you sit on the couch isn't going to work. Five days ago I was hit with a cold/flu and was confined to bed. I thought bugger it, I feel garbage anyway I'll go cold turkey and ride it through. So I'm at the end of day 4 with pain killers, ice-cream, protein shakes, and  Netflix. Nobody questions me because 'the flu' and I can't believe the amount of energy I have back already! Is it boring and tough? Yeah but so what! Face it with a positive attitude because you're doing something good for you. Just don't walk around wallowing in every sensation and freaking out. Power of the mind. You can do it.

Been on this medicine venlafaxine for a couple of months now after trying multiple antidepressants. Truly has changed me back to my old self. I have suffered from depression for years now and it has bought me back to my old energetic happy self. Before this medicine I  had lost interest in normal daily activities. This truly has saved me.

Effexor XR (venlafaxine):Effexor is a powerful drug that is extremely destructive, I was slowly losing sanity after only couple of months of taking it.Unfortunately there is a choice from 1 to 10, not -10, that would be my rating.Effexor withdrawal, as bad as can be is more desirable than ever taking one more tablet.I noticed that they don't come with any instructions and warnings, if I read it, I would never take one.Lucky I guess I wasn't using them for long

Effexor XR (venlafaxine):This is rubbish, don’t take it. I was feeling bad after going through some difficulties time in my life and thought I was depressed because I didn’t seem to be as happy as I was before so I went to a dr and she told me I had depression and prescribed the Effexor 75mg with sleeping pills. She told me I need to take Effexor for 6 months but first with sleeping pills for two weeks. I took only 2 pills for 2 days! It was awful  I felt like a zombie I couldn’t function or think or concentrate or feel. Nausea and slurred speak, extreme fatigue. I stopped the medicine after the second pill. I immediately felt better, meds are not for everyone. It would have been a life mistake to take this med for me.

Effexor XR (venlafaxine):My health issues are PTSD, Depression, Anxiety, Social Anxiety, bipolar disorder. I spent 3 total days on this medication. The first 2 days, this medication seemed to work okay but made me quite moody. By the 3rd day, I felt horrible. I woke up from a nap feeling extremely spacey, foggy, and my memory was horrible. It was almost as if I never woke up fully. By losing my memory temporarily, I immediately panicked and started crying. This medication scared me and I no longer used it after the 3rd day. I would’ve rather stayed on Lexapro, which lowered my libido significantly, than this medication. Absolutely horrible for my body.

Effexor XR (venlafaxine):This medication has helped my depression heaps. I'm on 225mg Effexor XR however I am worried when I eventually stop the medication the withdrawals will be insane.Effexor has helped settle my depression and the only issue I have is the sex drive is at an all time low because of it.

Effexor (venlafaxine):Reading reviews online WILL freak you out about this drug, and as someone who used it for panic disorder and extreme anxiety (as well as depression) these reviews on here DEFINITELY terrified me. First off, relax. Taking any new drug for the first time can be scary because your body's adjusting, but freaking out about any little symptom will only make your experience worse. Now on to my experience: The first couple weeks I experienced nausea and maybe a bit of sleeplessness? But nothing too crazy. Lost a bit of weight too as it suppressed my appetite. I really do believe this drug helped calm my nervous system enough so that I was able to function normally again, and so far after the first month I don't experience side effects at all. Don't be scared about all the wacky reviews, people can psych themselves out when influenced by others opinions.

Effexor XR (venlafaxine):I have been on this drug for about 3 years. This drug has its positives and negatives....after being on it for so long I’m starting to think the negatives out weigh the positives,the side effects long term are horrible, non stop night sweats, if you miss a dose you’ll know, cuz it feels like your whole body gets random electric shocks ( especially in the arms or hands ), little to no interest in sex, random sleep patterns....I’m sure I could list more

Effexor XR (venlafaxine):I've been on effexor for about a year. Started it in Jan last year along with buspar. I am 55 and with menopause I got depression and severe anxiety.  This combination of medication has really changed my life. I have a lot more get up and go. It is the combination that works for me I think.

I had suffered from dysthymia since I was 14. At the age of 20 I went to seek help for my condition. Been taking different types of SSRI for one year and due to many side effects I was put on venlafaxine 150 mg.After a while my life became wonderful. I was flourishing and most of my bad feelings just went away. My self esteem went up. I felt normal, woke up every morning with good energies. First time for years I was happy - actually happy. That has been the best days at my life. And then everything deteriorated as I decided to stop it. First I had the dose reduced to on 75 mg, after that 37.5 mg. It was very hard quitting this drug. My dysthymia came back.Been feeling bad for 1 year after I quit, so I decided to start taking this drug, that changed my life, again. But it didn't work. I guess I'm thankful for this drug for breaking my illness. This drug actually stopped my dysthymia for a while. After seeing it didn't work the second time I have been trying different types of SNRI, SSRI, vitamins, b12 supplements but none of them worked.

This medication venlafaxine saved my life. I tried Cypralex, Prozac and several others and none worked until I took Venlafaxine. I lost a little weight, but I had no other side effects. I'm on a daily high dose, and it's been working great for 2 years now.

Effexor XR (venlafaxine):Effexor ruined my life. After 3 years I am in complete agony. Pain all over and it stopped working. I tried to switch to another drug and the withdrawals are much worse than heroin. My body is crunching all over. Haven't slept in months. Can't use my brain. Stay away from this!!! I can't work, I am on my own and will be homeless soon! The withdrawals are unbearable! Doctors tapering is wrong!

I was on Citalopram since 2014 originally. I had always dealt with minor depression , sometimes major. I recently just switched to Venlafaxine by recommendation of doctor after I mentioned that I was feeling always tired and fatigued , eating excessively , didn’t have too much of a sex drive, still would feel depressed from time to time, and just wasn’t sure if the medication was still working. It’s been about a month now on venlafaxine and I feel great. I have a new found confidence and have strong tunnel-vision successful thoughts. I feel at peace with myself and so much more content. I am also not over eating and have lost a bit of weight which was nice. The cons of it so far has been I haven’t had the easiest time sleeping for one. Orgasms have felt not as strong and kind of delayed so to speak. Also I can be a little more irritated than normal and can get pretty angry.

I'm on venlafaxine 225mg for depression and at first it was OK made me feel me not depressed again and  more confident but these days it's making me feel sick and having to lie down all day its awful and feel like coming if them to start a new medication

Effexor XR (venlafaxine):This drug ruined my life. I stopped taking it months ago and I still suffer constant headaches, weakness, body aches. I can't do ANYTHING. I feel like I don't have enough power for taking a bath and brushing my teeth.

Effexor XR (venlafaxine):I have struggled with eating disorders (Anorexia and Binging) for about 4 years now. It started at 16 and slowly began to follow me into college. I’ve struggled with relationships and often find myself extremely depressed and more anxious than ever. I started Effexor about 2 weeks ago now and the first few days were much like the experiences listed on here. I have done MDMA before and it does feel like that for the first two days. However, after I got through that stage each day has been getting better. Colors seem brighter and my motivation has started to get better. Before, I had struggled with finding any interest in life and everything seems a little bit more open each day I wake up. I do have some very vivid dreams and find that during the night my depression gets a little worse, but it has slowly subsided and I’m able to push away thoughts that normal frustrate me. I’m excited to see how each day goes moving forward.

They kicked in nicely after two weeks and stabilised my mood. For the first week I had Sedoxil (Mexazolam) to counter the anxiety. I’ve been around 4 weeks taking Venlafaxine and the side effects I’m experiencing is slight headaches and ejaculation but it seems to be improving by the day. From my experience I’ve found that your mindset should be that these pills give you that push you need but having a positive mindset, exercise and will help the medication big time!

My doctor tapered me off venlafaxine 150 mgs over 2 weeks bridging me to prozac. It was the WORST! I was a healthy person before this happened. I was bedridden for 3+ yrs and still having symptoms over 6 years later. Out of desperation I started a FB support group. I've learned so much over the years and now I help educate those needing help tapering as well as withdrawals and protracted withdrawals.

Effexor XR (venlafaxine):At first, I thought this medication was helpful. But six weeks later it hasn't helped my depression or constant fatigue. It is not a bad medication, instead, it didn't work for me. Good Luck. When I see my doctor, I will try Cymbalta.

I was very depressed and sad for many years (with suicidal thoughts) and didn’t believe anything could ever help me. I have tried a lot of SSRI’s but they had minimal effect. 3 months only on Venlafaxine and I feel 90% like my old self. I am very impressed and excited with the medication and I don’t mind being on it forever. My dose was initially 37.5mg and slowly increased to 112,5 (my doc suggested  150 as a therapeutic dose  but I have low weight so we decided that 112,5 were ok)

Effexor XR (venlafaxine):I will be 60 this year.My first experience with treating my anxiety and depression started around 1968 with a doctor convincing my adoptive mom to put me on Ritalin-In 2004, my Dr placed me on Effexor XR. Within a week I felt relaxed and human.About a year ago I had a really bad breakdown my current doctor suggested I up the Effexor dosage to 150mg per day. It worked,  except for that I have lost my drive and ambition. I know I have things to do, they just do not seem to interest me enough. I get the things done I have to; then I just kinda slack down.Effexor saved my sanity so to speak; but have lost the extreme drive that propelled me in my younger days and I wish for that back!I just wonder if after 15 years on Effexor if there is something that betters it in the 'drive' and emotion department.Again, wonder drug.Sign me,Depressed from birth.

Effexor XR (venlafaxine):I'm extremely tired all the time. The doctor wants me to switch to Cymbalta, but the reviews aren't great and I don't want to go through withdrawals especially now. Trying out Nuvigil to see if it helps the fatigue.

Effexor XR (venlafaxine):Hello, I was prescribed this drug by a PCP. I wanted to try Effexor for depression, anxiety, and irritability. I took one dose, 75mg. I felt so bizarre. Felt like I was on drugs. I’ve actually  done ecstasy before, years ago, and this is what it felt like. Jaw clenched, no appetite, tremors. I felt like I couldn’t look at my boyfriend. Like my eyes wouldn’t focus. That night, I could sleep. Dreams seemed to start before my body was asleep. It’s like you’re aware of the bizarre dreams while they’re happening. I will not be taking this drug. I’d rather be depressed.

Effexor XR (venlafaxine):I had a hard time going on this medication.  Started at 37.5 and went up to 187.5.  All I wanted to do was lie down in bed because it made me feel unwell.  Even lying down I wasn't tired but wasn't able to concentrate or watch TV or read a book.  I got a lot of SI as the dose increased.  It settled down above at 150 but I was still getting it.  I am in the process of going off it and immediately starting to feel better for it.  I am sure this is good for some people but wasn't for me.

Effexor XR (venlafaxine):I was put on Effexor XR for depression after the other medication was not available. It was awful from the get go. My sense of smell was heightened, I had severe nausea ,hot flushes were terrible (worse than menopause )felt dizzy all the time ,and my mouth tasted awful and no matter what I did it never changed. I have know been off it for over 6 weeks and back on my normal medication but the feeling of nausea, dizziness and and the taste and feeling in my mouth is still horrible and the hot flushes are out of control. I spoke to my Dr and she looked at me as though I was crazy and ignored my questions. I honestly wish I had never taken the stupid things, they have ruined my life.

Within 1 week I started feeling better, but then my weight was fluctuating up & down a kilo or 2 a day.  I had been on KETO for the prev 8 weeks & had lost 12 kgs. 5 weeks after starting the drug I am finding I have severe twitching at night, insomnia so bad that I barely sleep 100mins a night, severe constipation even tho I drink 2 ltrs of water a day, brain fog & I am sweating like a pig all the time. I am menopausal however the flushes had really settled down until I started this drug now I am constantly sweating, uncomfortable, irritable & nauseous from being constipated & goodness knows what.  I had bad issues with coming off tramadol after knee replacement surgery 4 mths & my partner said when I was twitching away in bed, that it reminds them very much of the how I was trying to come off of that. I'm frankly a little scared of all of this. I'm going to just stop & go cold turkey & hope I will manage as I just don't want any more of this mind bending, body ruining garbage in my system.

Effexor (venlafaxine):I wish I could have checked this medication prior to taking it.Unfortunately I was in a behavioral facility and had no access to the internet.The side effects are terrible From extremely dry mouth to being overly tired.I’m tapering off right now and hope I don’t have difficulties with that.Goodbye Effexor and good riddance.

Effexor XR (venlafaxine):Started weaning off  Effexor 150mg 1 year ago. Got to 37.5mg with hardly any side effects. Then weaning off 37.5mg was terrible. Headache/head pounding, nausea, vertigo, diarrhea, extreme tiredness, random crying spells, very emotional, etc.  Did a lot of research and trusted that it’d get easier with time. 4 wks later, finally feeling physically well again...Then it got bad. Sense of constant dread, horrible anxiety, heart racing, emotional as hell, trouble sleeping, extremely depressed and felt like a zombie. Missing work, sleeping all day, no motivation to do anything.  Went back to doc and she put me back on the 37.5mg. Extremely disappointed not to get off of this medication.  Been 3 days since getting back on it, starting to feel somewhat normal again, just want my life back. Wish I’d received more info when I was first prescribed it- had no idea it would be such a nightmare to try to get off of it. This experience has shaken up my whole world. BEWARE

Note: I only gave it 9/10 because I haven’t been on it long enough to give a full rating. I started Venlafaxine ER 75mg and The first few days were a little rough, but I knew it would happen. It was mostly some mild nausea,  low appetite and some dizzy/drowsiness. I can feel those side effects lessen more and more every day. I have already found I am able to wake up in the morning and things don’t feel so heavy. I wake up on my first alarm, or even before it, and I’m ready for the day to begin. I’ve had a much more positive outlook, and I know the meds haven’t had time to fully work, but just the thought of them working keeps me going. But I do feel a physical and mental difference. It’s honestly been great so far and I’m excited to see how much more I can improve! I know a lot of people dislike this med due to side effects or what have you, but I think it’s wonderful for the right people. Don’t give up hope!

I was diagnosed with severe depression and anxiety. I’ve lived with it for well over a decade. Always been able to manage, with bouts here and there. Then my Dad unexpectedly passed and with several other family situations that snowballed since, my depression and anxiety was through the roof to the point where I went to our doctor. She prescribed 20mg of Citalopram, then 5 weeks later we upped it to 40mg. Without great results after several weeks, we cut back the Citalopram to 20mg again and introduced venlafaxine XR at 37.5mg. I’ve been on this combo for a little over a week and feel so much better already! I take both at night before bed & sleep great. Wake up at 5:30 feeling rested and energized. I was lucky and the only side effects I had from either are occasional hot flashes, sweating a little more than usual at times and vivid dreams. I can deal with that! I gave it a 9, because I haven’t been on that long but can already tell a difference.

I have taken Venlafaxine on 187.5 for about 4 years now.  I had tried different meds for my anxiety and depression and this one is perfect for me. I never experience side effects and rarely feel depression or anxiety. I am actually slowly weaning off at this point, and that is also going well. :)

Effexor (venlafaxine):I was on apparently the lowest dose of 37.5mg for anxiety and I had the worst experience of my life. I had severe gut pains everyday and felt hypoglycaemic all the time. I thought my liver was going to give out it hurt so much. I was not myself. I was more anxious and depressed on the meds than I was off them. I couldn’t take it anymore and took myself off. Quitting cold turkey probably wasn't the best idea but make sure you go to your doctor to get tapered off properly first to avoid major withdrawal symptoms. I do not recommend this medication it’s not worth the risk.

Effexor XR (venlafaxine):Find Effexor a little too stimulating compared to SSRI medications. Will stay on it for a few more days and write another review in a few weeks. I'm going back to the original instant release tablet form instead of the capsule extend release (XR). I think taking my med twice daily will be more effective without the additional anxiety that I am experiencing. Also, I find Effexor to be more stimulating that Adderall.

Effexor XR (venlafaxine):I started on 150mg of Effexor after Zoloft didn’t work then went up to 225mg and this medicine after 6 months made me more depressed. All I wanted to do was eat sleep and do nothing. I had outbursts of crying, had nightmares . I have PTSD and MDD . My doctor is changing me over to Wellbutrin . Hopefully it will work .

Effexor XR (venlafaxine):Effexor almost ruined my life. When I was 13 and I didn't fit in with my peers my doctor decided that I must need antidepressants. This medication was useless in treating my depression as I was not actually clinically depressed. I was just a teenager going through teenage carp. I tried to go off the medications but would get sick with seizures when I tried. One day at age 26 I decided enough was enough and went off cold turkey. It was rough. I could not go to work, was getting seizures daily and living with constant nausea. But after 3 months I started to get better. The seizures became fewer and farther between and the nausea stopped. Fast forward 10 years and I'm in a good career, am in great physical shape, have a stable mood, good self esteem, an excellent credit score, and live the life I used to dream of living. Getting off Effexor was the best thing I have ever done for myself. It cleared my mind and allowed me to find myself.

Effexor XR (venlafaxine):I’m on my fourth week of Effexor @ 75mg  dose now and it just started to work for me, so far so good. I’m on 75mg ,my sex drive is back on the fourth week and have not issues ejaculating. I take zinc and vitamin d with it. Male 45 years of age
Made me more depressed than I've ever been in just a couple of days. horrible drug
Effexor XR (venlafaxine):Too early to tell if the Effexor is working for me depression. Tried Prozac but unsuccessful. Just into week 2 of Effexor, and will wait for 3-4 weeks for result.
Effexor (venlafaxine):I was only on this for a few days and had severe panic attacks, will never take a SNRI again!

Effexor (venlafaxine):I was prescribed Venlafaxine for major depression and debilitating anxiety while going through a massive life crisis (business and relationship divorce and resulting bankruptcy) about three years ago.  My depression was my own worse enemy as when I needed to be sharp and confident for attorneys, I was a sobbing mess. My anxiety was  debilitating and turned into panic attacks. While I don't think I would have taken my life, I certainly wasn't afraid to die.The crisis is finally behind me, and I have tapered from 225mg to 37.5mg over the last 3 months.The only downsides were, for me, cognitive function, apathy, and poor memory. I was unable to orgasm on the 225 mg dosage.It is important to mention that I did not get through this with drugs alone. I had a strong network of friends, family, attorneys, and healthcare professionals.Do not be ashamed of your mental health crisis! Be honest with yourself and your friends and seek professional help!

Effexor XR (venlafaxine):It didn't work for my depression. Gained 12 pounds in a month. I know it's not supposed to be one of those antidepressants that causes weight gain but hey it affects everybody differently and I got to be the one that gained the weight. BTW, don't bother with genes testing either as it stated in the results that effexor would work for me.

This drug venlafaxine totally destroyed my life.When I was on it I didn't care about anything.Now that I stopped taking it, I feel like garbage and I can't do anything.I'm completely useless. Thanks a lot, Doctor.

Started on 37.5 mg of Effexor -X-R after coming off Parnate which had worked for over 15 years but due to a shortage had to change medications. What a disaster. Effexor dose is now on 75mg daily and my depression is worse, always anxious to the point of not being able to leave my house,I feel like I'm not medicated at all.Will be stopping this medication as soon as possible.I want my life back.

Effexor (venlafaxine):I would just like to point out that every single person is different and adjusts to these medications differently. I had 3 suicide attempts before accepting medication and was put on Effexor. Effexor changed my life, until it didn’t. For 2 years it helped me to function normally, I went back to work, the suicidal ideation ceased and I was able to manage my depression. After a long time though I felt numb and wanted to get off of it. No one ever warns you about coming off Effexor. There is a whole group on Facebook just for coming off it. The withdrawals are worse than any drug I know. I counted every day. It was 12 days of agony before I felt any sort of relief. It was pure, utter awfulness. But I look back and think of what Effexor did for me when I first started this medication, and it gave me my life back. So despite the horrible effects coming off this drug, it still helped me immensely.

Effexor (venlafaxine):I have been on 300mg for the past 5 years, I cannot handle the withdrawal symptoms as the feeling of being completely disconnected from reality is too intense let alone the nausea etc. I'm 25 and worry that this will eventually do irreversible damage.  The side effects are not worth it for me but again, I cannot stop taking it even though I want to
Effexor XR (venlafaxine):So far, very good medication. A little sluggish and tired the first few days. My vision is not as blurry like other antidepressants and no nightmares either.

Effexor XR (venlafaxine):I’ve been on Effexor for about a year.  I take 75mg ER a day for depression associated with bipolar disorder and anxiety/panic attacks which were at such a high level that it led to pseudo seizures. I have had amazing results. I had my first winter without a major depressive episode and the episodes that I have now are nowhere near as intense. My anxiety is at all time lows as well and I am able to hold a job for the first time. This is all in conjunction with cognitive behavioral therapy and lifestyle changes. But the withdrawal symptoms from missing a dose are HORRIBLE! You get brain zaps which are similar to vertigo and flu like symptoms such as aches/pains and upset stomach. This is in addition to your depression and anxiety levels sky rocketing. When I first started the med I had some nausea and dry mouth for a couple of weeks but it passed quickly. Overall, I have had amazing results.

I had been taking Prozac for about 16 years.  A new doctor said it may not be effective for me anymore and switched me to Effexor.I took it for about 8 months are noticed how much I had deteriorated mentally while taking it.  Getting through the day became hard, I had no energy and was not able to enjoy anything in my life.Getting of the drug was a terrible experience.I am now back on Prozac (different doctor) and feel normal and again able to enjoy life to some degree.

Effexor XR (venlafaxine):My prescription was for anxiety, pain and depression. After taking it for a year I beg to discontinue taking it. PLEASE READ OTHER REVIEWS ON THE INTERNET REGARDING WITHDRAWALS. I have spinal cord damage and have went through withdrawals from opioids. The withdrawals from this was ten times worse and took almost a year. After going to the lowest dose I was ready to start the every other day. That did not work. One day and brain zaps, dizziness, nausea and a horrible sense of unwell. I took the pill apart and reduced it by ten little grains each week. It did not matter. Each ten was a horrible withdrawal. Down to five grains and stopped. I still had brain zaps and incredibly horrid withdrawals for weeks. This drug should not be on the market.

Effexor (venlafaxine):You better make damn sure your diagnosis is correct because if you are manic depressive instead of plain old depressed this medication could cause huge disruptions in normal life which it did to me ...twice.

This venlafaxine medicine ruined my life. It felt like I had the flu for the first three weeks I was on it, complete with nausea, body aches, and chills. After those symptoms subsided, I had anxiety for a couple of weeks until my doctor increased the dosage. Once it was up in my system, I did get pain relief for about 2 months until it slowly started to make me more and more depressed. My doctor and I decided to taper it back down, and although we went slowly, it caused severe mood swings, anxiety, and horrible rebound pain. He suggested using one dose of Prozac to help with the withdrawal, but the Prozac made me severely nauseous and dizzy for two days. The Effexor stayed in my system for over two months after I discontinued it. I haven't taken it for about 9 weeks now, and I am still severely moody, anxious, and experiencing increased pain. This stuff seems to have helped some people, but it has been like poison for me, and I have no idea how I am going to get put of this depression.

Effexor XR (venlafaxine):Hi all I thought I would share my experience with Effexor XL.  I have been on an anti depressant since 2000.  Started with Paxil, then Citalopram, and finally Cymbalta. The Cymbalta stopped working and I was prescribed Effexor XL and am in the middle of my second week. When I first started taking it, after a couple of days I was feeling very odd, extremely fatigued and very sleepy but went with it. I researched this med and read many reviews. I’m so grateful for the reviews people have posted. I decided to stick it out, at least for a month. So happy I did!  After sleeping every spare moment the first week, it appears that side effect has alleviated. I’m feeling pretty good and am looking forward to my days now. The website says if you have an improvement in the first week or 2, that it’s a good sign the medication is working.

I took escitalopram for several years with mixed results and recurrent symptoms. Eventually switching to venlafaxine and have had remarkable improvement to memory and general mental stability. Though I find if I miss a pill In the morning I get withdrawal like symptoms in the afternoon.

I am taking Venlafaxine 75mg extended release now 3 months, started with half dose, at the beginning terrible side effects which I needed anxiolytics for, now feel much better.  I do not know for future but this helped a lot to be relax, it helped for the anxiety, suicidal thoughts, sleep; I would recommend this drug

Effexor XR (venlafaxine):After 15 years of struggling with deep depression, pmdd, and post partum depression, 1 suicide attempt and 1 hospitalization, I have found the medicine  Effexor that has worked for me. It's been a long road but now I'm at peace and living life to the fullest.

I  went into to a really dark place when taking this medication. I told the dr I felt awful so she raised my dose, & I became a danger to myselfI got off of the medication after taking it for way too long (for me) and felt better that I was on it.  On Celexa  now and it works well for me. The venlafaxine was terrible for me. People truly do differ though. I am not in the under 24 black box category age. I was in my 40s when I had this awful experience.

Effexor XR (venlafaxine):26 yrs old female severity of my depression & anxiety is at its worse. Recently had a few deaths in the family last few months. I was diagnosed with depression@ 13 years. Tried a few other meds prior but never really stuck to them since they didn’t work. This time I am trying to stick to meds. Started me at 37.5 mg after a month I’m on 75mg. I’ve been on it for a little over two months, depression has subsided better than what it was. But my anxiety it worse, I’ve had 2 trigger unknown panic attacks while driving. I wake up a few times at night, my dreams are crazy wierd ,sometimes scary & very vivid. I wake up sweaty at night. Don’t skip a dosage for 2 days, I did accidentally & withdrawal symptoms are pretty intense (nausea , lightheaded & difficultly catching breath) currently experiencing breast tenderness (3weeks), not sure if it’s from the meds or not. looking to possibly switch to focus on controlling anxiety&difficulty with concentration

I have been struggling with anxiety and depression for about 6 years now. A symptom of these conditions is chronic insomnia. After trying lots of different natural and pharmaceutical treatments, I finally finally found something that works for me - venlfaxine. My mood has majorly lifted, my anxiety minimized and I feel more myself then I have in years. I am so grateful that I never gave up on trying and found something that works for me. This medicine has pulled me out of a dark place and allowed me to feel happy and more able to cope with life.

I have been on venlafaxine for ~5 years, it has been an incredible drug for me. I’ve tried lots of antidepressants & eventually they stopped being effective but venlafaxine has been really effective. I don’t remember there being any side effects to start- I had an awful relapse from coming off the last drug so it was actually very beneficial to have relief from that. I took 150mg modified release which I took at night  to avoid any nausea. Now in the process of cutting down from 225mg - 150mg. I’d like to be off medication as I’ve been on medication for over 10 years. I’ve addressed lots of things in my personal life and I have much better coping strategies. Having said that, I once ran out of my medication for 2 days and experienced awful side effects. So I’m apprehensive about reducing. I’m alternating between 150 and 225 for a few weeks and then staying on 150 for a while. I’ll see how I feel and take it from there.

Effexor (venlafaxine):It ruined my life. Was on it for 13 years and tapered off it March 2018. Everyday intense cognitive problems, intense headaches and stomach problems. Even if I missed a dose I felt incredibly sick. I am disabled because if it. I'm 29.

Was on 300mg of Effexor for just over a year. It worked absolute wonders for my depression and anxiety. People noted that I'd become much more laid back and less aggressive. Unfortunately, I started getting all sorts of side effects - blood pressure issues, fainting, tachycardia, breathlessness, skin complaints, etc. It turned out that I'm a poor metaboliser and that I can't process venlafaxine properly hence the health issues. I've therefore had to come off the drug. I tapered down over the period of 3 months and apart from a bit of dizziness and nausea have had no major issues. Most of the sides I was experiencing have cleared up and I suspect the rest will given time. I've given it a 7 as it was a very good drug for what it was supposed to do. It's just a pity that my body couldn't handle it.

Effexor (venlafaxine):This was the worst of of all medications i have tried for anxiety and depression. This antidepressant made me more depressed than I have ever been in my life and made me suicidal. I tried it for 6 weeks and now am in process of weaning off this dirty drug.  Poison.

I hate it.  Every pill I take makes me gag.  My choice is either 6 pills or 3 horse size capsules.  I wish there was a shot.  If I miss a day, I have a nauseated stomach, my mind feels weird and I also have diarrhea.
Effexor XR (venlafaxine):Been on Effexor XR for 20 years. I have no complaints

Worst depression med ever. At first I didn't have any bad side effects. Over the last week all I have felt is like I'm high and in a out of body experience. It feels like my head is going to explode and is detached from the rest of me. I cry for no reason all day. I'm sick to my stomach to the point I want to sleep because it's all that makes me feel better. I feel like I have lost all muscle strength and I'm a fairly strong person. This is a dangerous medication and I have not felt like a human being in Over a week. I wouldn't recommend this med for anyone.

I've been taking it for about 4 months now? I had a big breakdown in March that led to being hospitalized and put on this. It SUCCKKKKSSS. If you miss even one dose your entire week is ruined. If you don't eat with every dose your entire week is ruined. Sometimes even if you take all of your doses correctly your entire week is still ruined because of the hundreds of side effects. My prescriber last time I talked to him said I'm getting too high of a dose (100mg twice a day) but I get withdrawals from it super easily so I probably wont be able to reduce it.  I'm still giving it a 5/10 though cause I am no longer suicidal anymore and I am more mentally stable than before. (not just taking it for depression, but anxiety, stress, and focus too [I have ADHD but I can't take meds for it])

Effexor XR (venlafaxine):I took this for depression and felt buzzed out and full of energy for three days.  Lost weight. Pupils were huge. Third night I bolted up right in bed my mind was racing and I was pacing the room, I was so scared I was losing my mind I begged an ambulance to come get me, had to lock my dogs in my bedroom as I was worried I might hurt them and I am a vegan!! Whatever that med is it is not for me I have never felt so out of control. Three days was enough it terrified me how it changed my mind like that.

I have clinical depression and was on Effexor for 6 months. The first 2 weeks were awful. The worst was the fatigue, I missed days of work because I was falling asleep at the wheel and was afraid to drive. Sometimes I took naps in parking lots. The fatigue got more manageable after 2 weeks, but I went from needing 6-7h to 9-10 never being enough. I was nauseous and dizzy for the first 2 weeks. Once used to it, there was less resistance to daily activities, but I also didn’t care about anything either. My body felt weak and stiff like I was 100 years old. I tore something in my knee that required surgery, and the doc said he’d never seen that injury in an otherwise healthy knee (young, healthy weight, no arthritis). Eventually the depression returned, and I weaned off. The 2nd day I felt out of body. I decided to go cold turkey because it was great to feel SOMETHING again. I felt so bad on Effexor in that I prefer the depression to messing with side effects.

Effexor (venlafaxine):I have finally had the courage to go through withdrawal symptom, agitation. Headaches, nausea, electric shock in my head. I am free of this drug and for the first time in years I feel like a human being. I am not alert, and feel a range of emotions. I was feeling nothing, numb for many years. This drug should be taken with great caution. I feel it is dangerous.

Been on venlafaxine for just a few months and it's amazing!! I gradually increased from 37.5mg to 150mg. I had nausea for a couple hours after taking in the first week, even threw up on day one but no big deal really. The only side effect I get from it now is a decreased appetite but it hasn't caused weight loss so no issue there (I'm already pretty small). I have a lot more energy and functionality and no more suicidal thoughts. I was prescribed this primarily for depression but it's also had a great effect on my anxiety and panic attacks and even my chronic pain has massively decreased! Genuine lifesaver

Effexor (venlafaxine):I have been on effexor CE 37.5mg for a month now. I was feeling better up until a few days ago, so I went and seen my Dr., so she upped my medication to 75 mg . So ever since she upped my dosage I've been having severe headache, neck pain, nausea,  feeling like my depression is getting worse, no motivation, crying spells throughout the day. So I'm going to give it a few more day's and if I'm still feeling the same, I'm asking to get tapered off of it. I just don't feel like myself, I just feel depressed all over again before I started it.  I'm scared to get tapered off tho because of the withdrawal symptoms I've been hearing.
Effexor XR (venlafaxine):This drug Effexor  is saving my life!

Effexor XR (venlafaxine):I've been weening off of Venlafaxine for the last month and a half.It's my least favorite medication, of all time.Every time I brought this up with my psychiatrist, she said, "What you need is more."Then she would raise the dosage.I hate the stuff.July 1, 2019 was my first day of being venlafaxine free.In the last 6 days I've gone through the 'feeling weird' and 'bad dreams' stages of withdrawal.They call it "discontinuation syndrome" but it's most certainly withdrawal... extreme withdrawal.Now I'm experiencing the 'involuntary weeping' and 'jitters' stages.I'm most likely going to stay in the bedroom, with the dogs, today.
Effexor XR (venlafaxine):This medicine has been a lifesaver for me! I feel terrific. The only dud effect I have is a numbness in my left hand sometimes but that didn’t start until 14 years on it. ??

Effexor XR (venlafaxine):I thank God for this drug. I've been on it for 18 months now.  I'm 55 yrs old woman and have suffered on and off with depression for most of my like. A couple of years ago  started suffering with Diurnal mood variation, also known as morning depression. I'd wake up suicidal, but would recover during the day. It was an awful relentless 24 hour cycle I was stuck in.   My doctor prescribed several drugs that made me feel worse, more suicidal, on the verge of being hospitalised again.  Then he prescribed Effexor -XR.  I felt lethargic and spaced out for 5 days, then fell asleep for almost 48 hrs! After that time I woke up, shook myself off and felt amazing!   I'm so well that  I'm happy stay on this drug for the rest of my life. My side effects have been, dry mouth, ( it went away after a couple of months) a very itchy scalp, weight gain, and vivid dreams.  Still, Im happy to put up with all of that, to simply not suffer from depression again.

This drug venlafaxine, has helped me with my depression and anxiety. It’s not like some other antidepressants that make you feel dead inside (Zoloft for me). This actually made me feel like myself. I had more energy and felt clear headed. I didn’t notice a big impact it had on my overall depressed mood but I can say that I am feeling much better now. So I guess that’s something. The downside of this medication is I get some very vivid dreams. Some of the dreams are nightmares and those are the dreams I fear the most because I can recall them in the morning. I would say I dream every single night with this drug. I can be pleasant but I can also be not so pleasant and actually quite terrifying. I gained a little bit of weight on the drug but I’m not sure if that’s because of my eating choices- which most likely it is. Other than that, I like the effect of this antidepressant and I’m glad I was prescribed it.

Effexor (venlafaxine):Hi,I have been taken Effexor for one year and a half. During my bad experience with medication I really found it the worst medicine had been launched in the market. I really don’t recommend it to anyone.

Effexor (venlafaxine):Sure saved the quality of my life.  I was not suicidal; I was more like the guy who didn't care if the plane crashed.I took Effexor for 8 years.  After that time period it had been a long, long time since I had felt depressed, so I began to taper off.  I think it probably took me a couple of months to get completely off.  I have been off for 5 years.I learned a lot about clinical depression and how to treat it.If my depression ever returns I will not hesitate to go back to Effexor.
Effexor (venlafaxine):I used effexor 5 months daily dose 150 mg with alprazolam which the doctor has prescribed, but I am still depressed and have insomnia.

I was finally able to go down from the max dose of this stuff to just the 37 mg after 7 yrs without really awful side effects on my own, I'll attribute that to tapering on vaca in MX that made it easier. I still am on a little of it. Anytime I tried to get off of it before, no matter how minute the taper, I would have the WORST most horrible brain zaps, nausea, etc, you name it. It made my hair fall out and forget about ever having a sex drive again! The only great thing about it was it made me lose a ton of weight, actually to the point my family was calling me Skeletor! Yea I didn't want to kill myself anymore but it was something terrible to be on.  I don't recommend this to ANYONE. I know what serious depression and GAD is, panic attacks etc, its NOT worth trying this med.

Effexor XR (venlafaxine):I have been on 300 mg of Effexor ER for 15 yrs. I have  Major Depression due to a Severe TBI (traumatic brain injury) I'm going off them with detoxing by a 1/4 every month. I'm now down to 150 mg. I have had serious anxiety & anger. Nothing else as of yet.

Venlafaxine made me gain a lot of weight very rapidly [3 dress sizes] without increasing food intake. I wasn't warned about this. It didn't change my mood for better or worse. On stopping venlafaxine I suddenly lost all the weight. I had dizzy spells for the first week, but felt better for stopping it. I then addressed the problems causing the depression and have not taken any medication in the 13 years since.

Effexor XR (venlafaxine):After trying Celexa (meh) and Aoloft (horrible), I asked my psych for an SNRI. Effexor has changed my life, depression AND anxiety have gone way down. I have motivation to do the small things that I was never able to before, like making my bed in the morning. No side-effects unless I take it without food, in which case I get little episodes of shaky/wobbly vision.

I’ve taken vanlafaxine for depression since I was 16, I’m 23 now (7 years) . It’s changed my life. I take the extended release version , 75mg daily. The side effects in the beginning were terrible. I had brain zaps, couldn’t sleep, felt like I was shaking  etc etc: , but after a week I had the energy to live again and conquer the world! I haven’t been depressed since. I do, however, get terrible night sweats to this day!

The venlafaxine was just awful, hated the medication while I was on it as it didn’t help at all so I was essentially just experiencing side effects (irritability, mood swings, weight gain) for no reason. Withdrawing from 150mg per day currently and the effects are absolutely disgusting - uncontrollable panic attacks, crying, confusion, hot and cold flushes, shaking, spikes of extreme emotion etc - pretty much any bad symptom I could have experienced I have. Wouldn’t wish this on my worst enemy.

Last summer due to a culmination of life’s stresses I became depressed, very unlike me because I am normally very on top of things. Although I avoid medication if at all possible, it was so bad I agreed to start on antidepressants.  Initially took  sertraline which made no difference whatsoever.  After four months the doctor changed me over to venlafaxine.  It was honestly life altering within days.  My world became brighter. The doctor said it was the first time she had seen me smile in four months. Initially was on 75mg but found quite quickly that half that dose worked as well.  Really worried about the withdrawal stories I had read but I have slowly reduced them over the last month with no signs of withdrawal.  (I do realise this is a small dose).  I am a middle aged women and I am sure that the menopause has had something to do with it.  I think the venlafaxine was the right chemical for what I needed.  Coming off it now but wouldn’t hesitate to use it again.

Many people seem to give up on venlafaxine and write it off- please bear with it if you are prescribed it! The first week I started taking it I was so sick, throwing up, dizzy etc. But my psych. told me to just keep trying. After about six weeks I felt a noticeable change. Let’s bear in mind that before hand I had spend 10 yrs trying every drug and therapy going and whilst I don’t want to be triggering let’s just say I was severely very, very poorly indeed. Now 1 year after starting this drug I am doing really well. I am working 30 hours a week- I couldn’t work before. I am doing a college course to gain further qualifications. I can socialise and I can spent time alone without the very poorly things happening to me. I have some side effects- I’m a bit sweaty and itchy and some sex related issues but these are much more bearable than my previous life. I urge you to please stick with any medication the doctor or psych. gives you or go back and talk to them again- don’t just stop!

I hated venlafaxine, I’d been on 2 other medications before to treat depression but changed due to having severe insomnia on them. Being only 23 I didn’t like the idea of being on this kind of medication and constantly changing them but my doctor prescribed me this and within a month I gained so much weight I went up 3 dress sizes. Because of this it made me feel worse about myself. I’m now covered in stretch marks and am struggling to lose the weight. I felt awful on them, they made me feel worse and my thoughts were unbearable

Effexor XR (venlafaxine):At present I am very scared of taking this drug. I feel happier today but am now on 225mg. And my eyes are wide open. Slept well but always do. Ate enormously yesterday the first day on higher dose. Very very keen for it to work. I took all XR tab at 7 this morning. Should I drive ? Have been depressed do long I don’t know normality

Effexor XR (venlafaxine):After being admitted to the hospital following a panic attack and suicide attempt, I was prescribed Effexor because I had tried four different SSRI's and none worked, so the doctor thought I should try an SNRI. My first dose was 30mg and half an hour after taking it I started to feel really weird- terrible headache, blurred vision, anxious/uneasy, jittery, and kept spacing out. The next day they moved me up to 75 mg and the headache went away but the other symptoms remained.  The next few days were awful. It gave me horrible social anxiety (which I don't normally have) and I couldn't get any work done because my eyes wouldn't focus and I would stare off into the distance for minutes at a time sort of dissociating. Also made me SUPER lazy. It made me just want to sit on my couch and stare into space.

Effexor XR (venlafaxine):I found out I was pregnant and was a little surprising as I’m almost 41. Intially I was ok and happy but within a week spiralled into suicidal thoughts and wanting to terminate the pregnancy. Prior to finding out I was pregnant I was not depressed or anxious- life was great. After almost three weeks of feeling like I was loosing my mind and trying all the natural things I could- acupuncture etc. I decided to try Effexor- I been on it once before 6 years before, I knew it worked but the last thing u want to be on when pregnant. I started on 75mg as I was running out of time to make a decision.  I endured the worst side effects for 5 days and on the 6th they decided to change back to 37.5 mg. I’ve been on that for almost a month now and that’s the right dose for me. I’m happy and excited about the pregnancy and I feel like myself again. Full of energy and thinking clearly. My sleep is a little bit interrupted but it’s nothing. The best decision I could have made!

Effexor XR (venlafaxine):I am a 43 years old man. I take Effexor XR 150mg since 2000 (yes I know it is long, but it is better than death). Ok, every 2-3 years I try to be "med free", "normal" and "out of the stigma", and each time it is the same. I crash. Hard. Each time, I play with my life. From the outside, I look successful, brilliant, intelligent, normal, etc. But I am sick as hell. Sick, but in treatment. I take care of me as I could and I really don't care about what people think about Venlafaxine now. I don't want to die. Believe me, noradrenaline and serotonin recapture is no garbage. You may need a little help for your brain. Refuse it if you like, but do something about depression before it will do something about you.

Effexor (venlafaxine):I have been taking Effexor for just over a year for comorbid depression and anxiety. My doctor tried several medications to address my depression and anxiety and Effexor proved to be the most effective. I started on 25mgs and went to 50mgs, which basically did nothing. It was when it was increased to 75mgs that I really noticed a difference. The trouble was that my motivation and energy levels dropped incredibly. I really struggled with foggy brain and forgetting everything. Also, rapid weight gain. I gained 6 kilos in less than a month and continued to gain over the next several months a total of 9 kilos. I was careful with what I ate and when I ate, but I still gained. We are switching the meds currently and the detox it brutal. I have been tapering for over a month and I am on day 3 of being completely off of it and I am still experiencing horrible withdrawal symptoms. The electric-like surges are painful and scary. The side effects just don't seem worth it and I will be happy when it is out of my system.

Effexor (venlafaxine):Was on lexapro for anxiety and depression but it just wasn’t helping so I switched to Effexor and I've definitely seen improvements. I used to have to take Xanax before work every morning but now I don’t. Highly recommend. Just remember to never skip a dose or you’ll feel terrible, my doctor told me.

So I'm recently freshly medicated after not seeing a psych for years. Effexor ER was the first one prescribed. Started 37.5 mg for a week then increased to 75mg. I initially experienced side effects pretty quickly after taking it (headache every day, nausea, super tired and drained) but they stayed mild. The main issue I had with it was that it just wasn't doing anything for my depression .It was like taking Pepto for a cough. I felt a little spike in energy and mood at first but it went away so quickly. I felt even worse, if anything. Still crying most days, suicidal thoughts not improved. At the last appointment I told doc what was going on and I'm switched to something else now. Went back to 37.5 mg for a couple days along with new meds to get off of it. No withdrawal symptoms at all. Maybe it was just being on such a low dose, but I may as well have been taking capsules filled with air.

Effexor XR (venlafaxine):This (Effexor XR) is a GREAT drug! For those of you who have had a bad experience you need to have the swab test done by your Dr  (covered by insurance) to find out what drugs work for you.Has been a lifesaver for me! I was switched by smart NP after taking Paxil for many years w many problems/after I took the mouth swab test & it showed Paxil was bad fit for me. I have zero side effects aside from a little weight loss which for me is awesome as I'm 57 & fit but had those nagging extra lbs. Extra lbs gone/mood lifted/don't dwell on stupid things.  I'll be on it forever as I'm permanently low in serotonin & NEED the boost. Without it it I just lay in bed & don't want to do anything. Get the swab test done & if this shows up in the left column try it! Little adjustments with dosage is required - just start at 75mg which helps teenie bit & then go up...Its also cheap if you pay cash...GOOD LUCK!!!!!!

Effexor XR (venlafaxine):I'm a 53 yr old female & still in perimenopause. Effexor XR 150mg has been a life changer for me!  I have been diagnosed with depression, anxiety, & also bipolar by different psychiatrists. I was depressed, very irritable/angry & moody.I couldn't function & or get out of bed, had no desire to do anything but sleep!Currently diagnosed: Major Depression Disorder (MDD) & Generalized Anxiety Disorder (GAD).  After being on many other antidepressants (Paxil, Cymbalta, Bupropion, Abilify, Seroquel - very sedating) & some bipolar meds (Lamictal, Risperdal, Depakote - which made my fine thin hair fall out) that didn't help for over 10 yr period, I was really losing hope & tired of feeling sad, horrible & constant worrying. I felt this was no way to live. After 8 months on Venlaxafine 150 mg XR, I feel so much better and much less irritable & anxious.
Been on venlafaxine slowly for nearly year. Now I'm on 225mg and I get so tired everyday, it's stopping me from doing things I used to do. Was thinking of halving the tablet

I started taking Venlafaxine 3 years ago. I started off not sleeping, feeling sick and really low, after a few months I found it helped then all of a sudden I felt it stopped. My dose kept being upped and the same happened but with it found my toilet issues were getting worse, I would sweat in the night and go dizzy if I missed one or took it late. I decided I couldn't take anymore of having it and the doctors didn't really seem to care about me just putting it up and leaving me too it. So I'm 3 days into not taking in after weaning myself off slowly, my head is constantly fuzzy and dizzy, I'm so exhausted mentally and physically, I'm emotional (happy, crying, laughing all within minutes), headaches, flushes and very angry. This is the worst tablets I have had with side effects being on and off them. I was surprised to read I was suppose to have regular blood pressure tests.

I have been on venlafaxine for over 10 years. I stopped them when I found out I was pregnant. Worst experience of my life. I was suffering for weeks. My son was born healthy with no problems. When I fell pregnant again 4 yrs later I spoke to my doctor about coming off the venlafaxine, he told me he would gradually reduce the dose as it’s better for myself and the baby, going cold turkey wouldn’t be good for anyone. My son was born with cranial defects and a heart murmur. After a lot of research..I found  these conditions are a side effect from Effexor. America has thousands of law suits yet to be addressed with pharmaceutical companies. On a good note, I’m awful without them. I would advise stopping them if you are trying for a baby or pregnant. I have found that while withdrawing from Effexor cod liver omega capsules stop the brain zaps - but don't take these if you are trying to get pregnant or pregnant as they have lots of vit A which can harm your baby. Take a couple every few hours. They make a big difference.

I have been taking venlafaxine XL 75mgs for depression, for about 2 years plus. The first dose I took I felt sick all day but since have been fine. I have been on many other antidepressants over the years but find this keeps me stable with no side effects.

Effexor XR (venlafaxine):I started taking 37.5 of Effexor XR with breakfast in the middle of December  for my depression after being on Celexa for many years. I'm a 44 year old  female and  I was told to just switch over. I was dizzy, spacey and sleepy for couple of weeks, lot of gas, bouts of stomach upset/poops. I struggled with bad anxiety during the first 10 days and then  that levelled out. I lacked motivation, although I knew what I wanted to WANT to do, just had no focus. My PMS was worsened beginning of Feb. and again in March. Completely drained, like fighting a tranquilizer. In April, mind wandering between past and present sadness. I was then bumped to 75mg daily and I'm at day 7, it's been a long week. Day 5 I had really bad anxiety -fearful, I felt paranoid for few hours not reason.  Then at 7pm, surge of energy couple of hours, sleep wasn't good. Day 6 I was teary and felt hopeless.Today I feel chill, not so spacey. Probably my best day, my appetite is ok, smaller, frequent meals plus a few snacks. I feel that this medication is good.

Effexor (venlafaxine):I had the worst depression and anxiety. I was taking Zoloft and it quit working. I am now taking Effexor and  my anxiety completely went away! I was having to take Xanax throughout the day for my anxiety before I took Effexor.  I now no longer have to take Xanax, I had NO side effects from Effexor and my depression is completely gone and my anxiety. The only thing it did not help is that I have no energy. I feel tired and fatigued and have no motivation to do anything. I also have had no problem sleeping at night.

I was on Zoloft for a few months and I thought it was working. Went to see a nurse practitioner in psychiatry and she said to try the Effexor XR. The nurse weaned me off the Zoloft and I started taking the Effexor XR and I had some energy the first day and then the energy seems to have gone away. I also have had episodes of nausea that lead to vomiting and I don’t have an appetite at all. I have to force myself to eat. I feel like a zombie all day. My sleep at night has improved. I have only been on this for about two weeks.

Effexor XR (venlafaxine):IT TOOK THE THE DRUG COMPANY 11 YEARS TO GET THIS APPROVED.  This drug should not be allowed on the market. I have been on SSRI's for 15 years and was switched to this pill which is the worst.   I was constantly dizzy on this, also  anxious and brain zapped.  If you take this medication an hour late you are sick.  It has a very short shelf half-life. Going off of it if you can is like one bad trip   I had breathing issues, my whole body ached so painful, vertigo, so dizzy, vomiting and I tapered off.  Slowly....it will take you 6 months to a year to taper off and get ready for the issues you will continue you to have.  Don't take it.  When I read the reviews I thought it would be different for me because of the lies from my doctor.    These reviews aren't lying or they haven't tried going off.  The XR is the only one that is approved???? the other Effexor is banned now.  Please go on something else. NOT A SNRI it will bring you to knees to pray your never took it.

Effexor XR (venlafaxine):Only took 37.5 mg effexor for 6 days, zero appetite, constant bloated sick stomach, lost 7 lbs and feel like a zombie, I’m completely emotionally numb/dead. I’ve been shaky, dizzy, thick headed and very fatigued. I admit I’m not depressed and crying but I feel soo sick that I can’t handle it. Sips of water make me feel nauseous. I need to know if I can just stop cold turkey since it was only 37.5 mg for 6 days? What do I do? Doctor thinks quitting cold turkey is ok but soo many horror stories online, I’m scared.

Effexor XR (venlafaxine):Effexor saved my sanity. I have been taking it for about 15years. I cannot take the generic brand . I take 37.5 once daily before bed. No side effects. Do not take the generic brand!

I felt okay on this drug the first 2 weeks, then the lovely side effects began, nervousness, headaches, tears, anxious, not sleepingl, oss of appetite etc. As the time went on  I felt okay again but after  5 weeks the side effects should go away right?? Then I got a bad chest cold.  Why would a drug give you so much drama??? If you go off it then you are worse? Lots of good options . The last drug I was on was sertaline I felt suicidal and I felt worse as the days went on.  Why tell me, why do drug companies  make a drug that makes a person so sick?????

This drug temporarily changed me as a person, and I do not recommend it, especially when treating depression and an eating disorder. I started Effexor XR and immediately noticed that I had a major difficulty controlling my impulses. I drank too much, stole, cheated, lied. Then, my psychiatrist upped the medication from 150 mg to 225 because she believed it was the worsening of my mental illness. After 6 mos, weened off of Effexor. although it was difficult, it felt as though a film had been wiped off my eyes After stopping the medication. I started to care about myself as a human being, slept more, began to eat normally, drank less, care about loved ones, and not see my life through this cloud in which Effexor had put me. I know medication is different for every person, but if you are having any of these effects, PLEASE WEEN OFF. It made me into a different person who lacked self respect and basic morality.

After trying other meds, this has been the worst medication I've taken. I started February 22nd taking 37.5mg. After 7-10 days I experienced heart palpitations intermittently  (which is a usual adjustment each time I started a new medication). As the days progressed the heart palpitations happened all day most of the day.  I feel like my heart is bouncing in my chest.  Also I'm experiencing indigestion. After seeing several docs for other medical things, each asked why my heart rate was so fast. I attributed it to the Venlafaxine.  It has become very bothersome and scary.  I'm wearing a 24-hour monitor to make sure I have no other heart condition (I'm age 66). I'm stopping my medication because of the daily, all day heart palpitations.  I wake up from my sleep feeling the sensation.

Effexor XR (venlafaxine):Please do not take this drug. I’ve had depression and anxiety for years. I’ve gone to many doctors and therapists and nothing has worked. About a year ago I was prescribed the generic venlafaxine. I exhausted all non drug options first and finally caved in. I decided to give up this drug recently and go back to trying more natural remedies. Going off has been a nightmare and I was only on a 75mg dose. I tried to taper off like everyone says but that wasn’t working. I’m on day 6 of diarrhea and stomach pains. The first day I couldn’t move I had such a headache and my whole body hurt. No drug should do this to a person. I read reviews just like mine and thought my doctor knew best. They don’t. You know what’s best. Don’t ignore your instincts. This drug does more harm than good and should not be on the market. Shame on the FDA for allowing the continued sale of this drug.

Effexor XR (venlafaxine):I've been taking this for about half a year now. It's been working great for me. My depression is a bit better, I get less suicidal  thoughts, and my social anxiety is reduced, however, I still do feel anxious (in non social situations) most of the time but at least I haven't had a panic attack in quite a while. I'm taking 75 mg every morning. The first week on it, I had severe headaches and felt really dizzy but it lasted only a week so that was fine. As side effects go, like any medication for anxiety and depression, my sex drive became nonexistent. One other thing - it causes you to have wild dreams, but to me this is more of a advantage.

Day three with extended release 75mg and felt better the first day.  My brain won't even entertain suicidal thoughts now and I feel myself smiling.  I am starting to do a few things around the house and not spend the weekend in bed. I am also on Lexapro 20 mg daily  and have benzos for anxiety which I rarely take.  I am not sleeping well, so no change there yet.  Sleeping pills do not work on me.  No side effects to report at this time.

Finally something that works for my major depressive disorder! I've tried so many other antidepressants before (sertraline, citalopram, escitalopram, etc.) and they didn't do much or the side effects were unpleasant.With Venlafaxine I have zero side effects and it WORKS.Of course it is different for everyone but for me this is a miracle and I can finally live life the way non-depressed people do. It is truly a new chapter in my life and I know I should not stop taking it now I feel better.

After trying about 11 different  medications since I was 12, I've been on Effexor 75mg for two months, starting dose 37.5mg for 3 weeks. My anxiety is completely gone. No more panic attacks, sleep paralysis, or self harm. My depression has worsened. I cry for about 2 hours every day without reason. It has limited my functioning. I have no motivation to do schoolwork, strengthen relationships, or even cook meals for myself. However I am happy that my anxiety is gone. I can now mingle among crowds of people, stay calm in traffic, talk to others including strangers with ease, sleep peacefully, and generally do the things that I want to do. My body feels better. I may request to add a medication for my depression and stay on effexor since it has done wonders for my anxiety.

The drug is good for depression, the withdrawal is bad.If you can make it past the third week of withdrawal, you will be a very different person. Light is brighter, taste is amazing, smell is stronger and you will get to have a new outlook. I was on that stuff for four years. Now I am on something different.

Effexor (venlafaxine):I've been on Effexor XR 37.5mg for 2 weeks now for anxiety and depression and am seeing good results already. Generally my mood is never stable, this medication has started to even everything out and I go through my days feeling content. My anxiety is subsiding and my mood and energy levels have increased.
